programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: The penguin keepers embark on their most ambitious project to date, building an underwater feeding machine, while a hyrax is rushed to the vet for some emergency dental work.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a cliff-side house in Devon, a bijou London property and former police cells in the Kent town of Ramsgate, before they are sold at auction. The pair then find out about the new owners' plans for their purchases and check on their progress at a later date.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones meets a man whose furniture business was razed during the 2011 London riots and a woman who was a member of the so-called `broom army'. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Amid complaints of rising prices, Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon, and Julia Somerville set out to reveal the true cost of Britain's fish and chips. Plus, the benefits given by supermarkets to dairy farmers and the foreign-sounding lagers that actually have their origins closer to home than most people imagine.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the market town of Newark, Nottinghamshire, as experts Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson help two teams scour an antiques fair seeking items to sell for profit at auction. Plus, Charlie finds out more about the extraordinary story of TE Lawrence, better known as Lawrence of Arabia.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Feelings run high on the day of Brian's trial, Paudge regrets abetting a thug, while a drained Rachel is feeling the pressure.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: With a top budget of £560,000, Jules Hudson assists a retired couple in their bid to move to Cornwall, where they hope to get involved in the local community.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Adam Partridge and Caroline Hawley uncover a few gems at Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, including a silver candlestick and some Coalbrookedale plates. Presenter Paul Martin delves into the Lake District's bobbin industry.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the opening night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, which will include the men's 10,000m final, as well as the opening round of heats in the men's 100m and women's 1500m. Great Britain's Mo Farah is expected to compete in the men's 10,000m as he attempts to add to the tally of gold medals he has claimed in this event at both the 2012 and 2016 Olympic Games, and the 2015 World Championships. Meanwhile, his compatriot Laura Muir will look to continue the incredible form that saw her win double gold in the 1500m and 3,000m at the European Indoor Championships earlier this year, while the biggest star in athletics, Usain Bolt, will begin his quest for gold in his final appearance at this Championships. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson, Denise Lewis and Paula Radcliffe, and commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter, Steve Backley and Toni Minichello. Coverage continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee faces a parenting dilemma as he worries that son Charlie is getting a reputation at school for being the class clown. But is it a simple case of the old adage `like father, like son'? Sally Bretton co-stars, alongside Hugh Dennis and Selina Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: An embittered lawyer decides to relive the wild, crazy days of his youth after his girlfriend is unfaithful, and enlists the help of two equally disillusioned friends in setting up a fraternity house next to his former college campus. Comedy, starring Luke Wilson, Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn and Juliette Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan (Yara Greyjoy) joins Matt Tebbutt in the studio kitchen to sample dishes prepared by chefs Dan Doherty and Ian Orr.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Former Great British Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain is in East Anglia as she continues her culinary road trip around Britain, going out to sea with Norfolk fisherman Richard Matthews to catch crabs for Vietnamese-style summer rolls. She then heads to Ely in Cambridgeshire to meet potato farmer and crisp factory owner Ross Taylor, using his snacks to make a crisp, chocolate and salted peanut dessert. Back in her kitchen, Nadiya creates a ploughman's cheese and pickle tart, and a herby chicken and potato salad.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A pair of nurses takes on a duo of paramedics in Derby, with the assistance of antiques experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. Meanwhile, Tim Wonnacott finds an archaic system of communication at the fair, before visiting the V&A Museum of Childhood in London.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two friends who bought a house together in Cumbria's Maryport discover a surprise in the form of an extra room they never new existed. Developers tackle a terraced house in Burton-upon-Trent, East Staffordshire, and an ambitious redevelopment gets under way in Deal, Kent.(n)

programme.title: I Am Bolt
programme.desc: Documentary about the life and career of world-record breaking Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt, who has won the 100m and 200m gold medals at the last three Olympics. The film follows him as he prepares for the Rio 2016 Olympics and there is archive footage of his personal life and from his athletics career.(n)

programme.title: The Heroes of Super Saturday: Jess, Mo & Greg
programme.desc: Michael Johnson takes a look back at the day of competition known as `Super Saturday' at the 2012 Olympic Games, focusing on Jessica Ennis-Hill, Mo Farah and Greg Rutherford. The former American athlete also meets up with each of the British stars to discuss what happened in their respective careers after that momentous day, as well as looking ahead to what the next generation of stars can expect as they head into the World Athletics Championships, beginning on Friday.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Continent
programme.desc: Anita Rani goes house-hunting in the Poitou-Charentes region of France to help a Gloucestershire couple who are looking for a new start.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an edition based on the subject of history, as Kate Williams, Adam Hart-Davis, Janina Ramirez, Andrew Graham-Dixon, Ben Willbond, Laurence Rickard, Lars Tharp and Tim Wonnacott try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Richard Osman is the man with the answers.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Two - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the second night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, which will include the men's 100m final. Should he have made it through to the final as expected, Usain Bolt will be making his final individual appearance at a major championships and will be looking to bow out while still the fastest man in the world. Plus, medals are decided in the men's discus and long jump, and women's 10,000m, the heptathlon continues with the shot put and 200m, and the women's 1500m semi-finals take place. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie
programme.desc: The indomitable Irish matriarch discovers that a plan is afoot by developers to buy the famous Dublin street market where her family has run a fruit and veg stall for generations. Assembling a band of eccentric allies, she plans to fight back, only to realise her daughter is not interested in taking over the family business. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Jennifer Gibney.(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Four teenagers accidentally run over a stranger and hide the body rather than inform the authorities, only to find themselves stalked the following year by a shadowy figure who takes great delight in disposing of them in a variety of gruesome ways. Horror, starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr and Anne Heche.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Richard Ridings to pick the TV shows that shaped his life, including the physical comedy of Harry Worth and the inspiration he gained from watching Oliver Reed.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: A BBC wildlife cameraman arrives to film Longleat's fastest mammals, a vet is called out to one of the antelope and there is an update on Anne the former circus elephant.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and David Harper advise two teams competing at Newark Antiques and Collectors Fair, Nottinghamshire, while presenter Christina Trevanion visits Derby Silk Mill.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits a floral paradise outside of Dublin and discovers how Jimi Blake fills his garden with flora for free. Elsewhere, Nicky Bailey demonstrates how to transform a bland patio into a space that looks incredible at twilight, and Mark Lane travels to Oldham to visit the newly opened Maggie's Centre.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman concludes his history of the First World War, focusing on the final 12 months of the conflict, when the country came close to defeat. He reveals how grieving parents held seances in the hope of contacting their dead sons and surgeons battled to rebuild the faces of the wounded, and tells the story of a maverick MP who tried to blame the crisis on a conspiracy of sexual deviants in government. Eventually, the tide of battle turned and the armistice was signed, leaving an exhausted nation counting the cost of four years of war. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner visit Suffolk, where they pick fruit for the chef to turn into a gooseberry and ginger biscuit fool, and go crabbing in Orford. Later, they meet some Suffolk punch horses, and chef Madalene Bonvini-Hamel creates a pork platter. Plus, how to cook a roast crown of chicken with a wholemeal pancake stack.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of dishes using game. The menu includes a venison dish from Rachel Khoo, Keith Floyd cooking with pheasant recipe, Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry's raised game pie, Raymond Blanc cooking with pigeon, and a rabbit dish from Nigel Slater.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Forest Elephants: Rumbles in the Jungle.
programme.desc: Scientist Andrea Turkalo examines the social bonds formed by elephants deep in the rainforests of central Africa. After more than 20 years of field study, she has begun to unravel the secrets of the animals' lives and the meanings of the sounds they use to communicate with each other. Richard Armitage narrates.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The family and the camp team celebrate the end of the tourist season, Samburu style. Sabu watches over the elephant mothers as they are about to give birth, while Frank and David try to safeguard the future of Samburu's wildlife.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the hunting tactics of the world's carnivores. Arctic foxes in the frozen north must collect food during warmer times to survive the winter, while the big cats of the southern hemisphere rely on stealth and surprise to catch each meal. The presenter also reveals how leopards and tigers are solitary hunters, coming together only to mate, whereas lions stay in family groups so they can tackle larger prey and better protect their young.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to St Andrews University in Scotland, where objects being valued include an exquisitely crafted netsuke - or miniature Japanese sculpture - bought in a charity shop for a few pence, a toy collection that inspired the owner to go on to become a fighter pilot and some of the earliest golfing trophies in the world. Plus, a collector with more than 1,500 pieces of post-war ceramics.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the opening ceremony at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, which famously staged the 2012 Olympic Games, and will play host to 10 days of competition in a multitude of track and field events featuring the best athletes in the world. Coverage continues on BBC One.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Prog rocker Rick Wakeman and actor friend Ian Lavender embark on the cross-country treasure-hunting challenge around Norfolk, joined by experts Raj Bisram and David Harper. While Rick uncovers hidden medieval graffiti in Norwich Cathedral, Ian examines the world's largest collection of model soldiers in north Norfolk. But which of the stars will make the most money at auction in Nottingham?.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the celebrated quiz as more contenders brave the infamous black chair. The specialist subjects in the first round are the four gospels, Margaret Atwood's MaddAddam trilogy, flags of the world and the colour films of Danny Kaye. As usual, the second round consists of general knowledge questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of geocachers takes on a trio with an interest in Vikings in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of exhibit, salt and pepper, outcast and roots manoeuvre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick Bailey brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive. Carol Klein pays the first of two visits to West Yorkshire to meet a couple whose outstanding planting has resulted in a garden full of late summer interest, while Joe Swift takes a look at a sloping and shady town garden to find out how the owner has designed this difficult space. Plus, the Dorset gardener who has created an Italianate idyll, and an in-depth look at the pelargonium. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: 2017 Day One Review.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents reaction to and analysis of the opening night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, as Paula Radcliffe, Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson offer their input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by James O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's British Open Highlights: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the second day of the event, which this year is staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife. Reigning champion Ariya Jutanugarn was expected to appear at this year's tournament, alongside the likes of Inbee Park, Yani Tseng, Michelle Wie, and British hopefuls Catriona Matthew - who triumphed in 2009 - and Charley Hull, and today was the day in which all players in the field were attempting to make the cut.(n)

programme.title: Blackthorn
programme.desc: Butch Cassidy lives in secluded exile in a remote Bolivian village, having survived his supposed last stand. After years away from home, he decides the time has come to return to his family in America, but on the way, he runs into an ambitious young outlaw and is drawn into one last criminal adventure. Western, starring Sam Shepard and Eduardo Noriega.(n)

programme.title: I Shot My Parents
programme.desc: The story of American teenager Nathon Brooks, who at the age of 14 shot his mother and father while they slept. Incredibly, they both survived, and Nathon is now serving 15-and-a-half years for assault with a deadly weapon. This documentary reveals how the couple are coming to terms with their son's actions, and also hears from Nathon as he strives to understand what he did and why he did it.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Sudan: The Last of the Rhinos.
programme.desc: The remarkable story of Sudan, the very last male northern white rhino on the planet. Snatched from his mother's side in Central Africa, Sudan became a prized exhibit in a zoo while the rest of his kind were poached to near-extinction. This programme focuses on the desperate battle to bring his sub-species back from the brink of extinction, told through the characters who have been involved in his life.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Spanish Main
programme.desc: Dutch refugees shipwrecked on the coast of Cartagene in Spain are imprisoned by a villainous colonial governor. However, the leader of the group manages to escape and goes on to become a feared pirate captain. He then returns five years later to exact revenge. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Paul Henreid, Maureen O'Hara, Walter Slezak and Binnie Barnes.(n)

programme.title: The Magic Box
programme.desc: Biopic of cinema pioneer William Friese-Greene, who gave up a successful career in photography to follow his dream of developing a camera that would capture moving images. However, his tireless experiments to perfect his creation would come at great personal cost. Starring Robert Donat, Maria Schell, Margaret Johnston, Richard Attenborough and Michael Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Two - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day two at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. British medal hope Katarina Johnson-Thompson gets her heptathlon bid under way with the 100m hurdles and high jump. Meanwhile, other Brits looking to get off to a good start in their events include 400m runner Matthew Hudson-Smith, hammer thrower Sophie Hitchon and 100m prospect Asha Philllips. Plus, qualifying for the men's shot put and women's triple jump, and the men's 800m heats. With commentary by Steve Cram, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Gennaro Contaldo joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to create an authentic lasagne with focaccia from scratch, while Kate Goodman offers a guide to choosing the right Italian red wine to make the perfect match. Great British Menu judge and restaurateur Oliver Peyton joins them for a debate on whether people should care more about where their food comes from.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team visits Manchester's Museum of Science and Industry, where Caroline Hawley and Michael Baggott search the queue for the best antiques to take to auction. Presenter Paul Martin explores the city's archive films and reads the first ever edition of the Guardian newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the celebrated quiz as more contenders brave the infamous black chair. The specialist subjects in the first round are the four gospels, Margaret Atwood's MaddAddam trilogy, flags of the world and the colour films of Danny Kaye. As usual, the second round consists of general knowledge questions.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the third of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Southampton pit their wits against a team from the University of Cardiff in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of geocachers takes on a trio with an interest in Vikings in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of exhibit, salt and pepper, outcast and roots manoeuvre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick Bailey brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive. Carol Klein pays the first of two visits to West Yorkshire to meet a couple whose outstanding planting has resulted in a garden full of late summer interest, while Joe Swift takes a look at a sloping and shady town garden to find out how the owner has designed this difficult space. Plus, the Dorset gardener who has created an Italianate idyll, and an in-depth look at the pelargonium. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Victorian Treat.
programme.desc: This time, confectioners Paul, Cynthia, Andy and Diana use original recipes to recreate a Victorian sweet shop, and discover how the quest to satisfy our national sweet tooth transformed Britain. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the sweet-makers head to Blists Hill, Shropshire, to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 19th and early 20th century England. The team recreate a range of Victorian treats to stock their sweet shop, from jars of boiled sweets to their own version of fruit pastilles, and an enormous Easter egg. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Proms Extra
programme.desc: Katie Derham is joined in discussion by tenor Stuart Skelton, soprano Ailish Tynan and gospel conductor and composer Ken Burton. The topic receiving scrutiny this evening is Beethoven's Symphony No 9, which is also known as `the Choral', and was the German composer's final complete symphony. Plus, a Proms centenary tribute to American jazz singer Ella Fitzgerald and her fellow bebop pioneer, the trumpeter and band-leader Dizzy Gillespie.(n)

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary examining what impact the relationships between cousins Nicholas II of Russia, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany and George V of the United Kingdom had on the outbreak of the First World War. This episode focuses on the story of the emerging divisions and rivalries between the inter-related royal houses of Europe during the 19th century. Featuring contributions by historians Karina Urbach, Miranda Carter and Piers Brendon. Tamsin Greig narrates.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Corporal Jones finds himself cast adrift during an exercise pitting Mainwaring and his home-front heroes against their arch-rival Captain Square - but fortunately, Frazer is on hand to help out. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Clive Dunn, John Le Mesurier and Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Billy Connolly: Portrait of a Lifetime
programme.desc: A programme celebrating Billy Connolly's 75th birthday and 50 years in the business, as three Scottish artists, John Byrne, Jack Vettriano and Rachel Maclean, each create a new portrait of the comedian and actor. As he sits with each artist, Billy talks about his remarkable career which has taken him from musician and stand-up to Hollywood star and national treasure.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: 2017 Day Two Review.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents reaction to and analysis of the second night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, as Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter, Steve Backley and Toni Minichello offer their input.(n)

programme.title: What We Did on Our Holiday
programme.desc: A couple whose marriage has hit a rocky patch take a trip to Scotland with their three children, to visit the husband's father on his 75th birthday. They try to conceal their marital strife to avoid spoiling the occasion, but have to contend with the kids giving away all their secrets. Comedy drama, starring Rosamund Pike, David Tennant and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's Open Highlights: 2017 Day Three.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the third day of the event, which this year is staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Janice Long introduce performances by Sandie Shaw and the Smiths, Phil Collins, Belle and the Devotions, Bob Marley and the Wailers, Duran Duran, Julio Iglesias and Willie Nelson, Echo and the Bunnymen, the Flying Pickets and Lionel Richie.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: At London's Royal Albert Hall, YolanDa Brown introduces a tribute to jazz greats Ella Fitzgerald and Dizzy Gillespie, in the centenary year of their births. Grammy Award-winning singer Dianne Reeves and trumpeter James Morrison perform with the BBC Concert Orchestra under the baton of John Mauceri, as they showcase some of the music most closely associated with the duo.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The comedian concludes his road trip through the American South by exploring the musical heritage of Mississippi and Louisiana. In Memphis, he meets songwriting partners Steve Cropper and Eddie Floyd at Stax Records, before going on the trail of the origins of both delta and hill country blues in the company of musicians Seasick Steve and Cedric Burnside. His final port of call is New Orleans, where he meets Dr John, Irma Thomas and Allen Toussaint, three of the city's most celebrated artists. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Oh! You Pretty Things: The Story of Music and Fashion
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne narrates this three-part documentary exploring the influence of musicians and designers on the coolest and craziest looks in Britain, and how fans emulated their idols. The first programme focuses on the golden years of the 1960s, when Mod legends the Small Faces became the best dressed band in England and the Beatles and the Rolling Stones embraced psychedelia.(n)

programme.title: Oh! You Pretty Things: The Story of Music and Fashion
programme.desc: The second episode focuses on the 1970s, which was a time of political, social and cultural upheaval in Britain, reflected best in the music and fashion throughout the decade. On Top of the Pops, Suzi Quatro unleashed her leather jumpsuit into viewers' living rooms as `the rock chick look' was born, while the fantastical world of prog rock saw its golden-caped leader Rick Wakeman gaining an army of intellectual followers. And as Queen rocked the stage in Zandra Rhodes-designed costumes, the international phenomena of punk began - and some say ended - with the Sex Pistols. Narrated by Lauren Laverne.(n)

programme.title: Oh! You Pretty Things: The Story of Music and Fashion
programme.desc: The final episode of the three-part documentary series focuses on the 1980s - a decade in which image became everything thanks to the arrival of the music video. From Dexys Midnight Runners in their dungarees to the flamboyant New Romantics of London's Blitz Club and the band with the look that typified much of the decade - Duran Duran. Plus, a look at the emerging popularity of urban street wear, led by Jazzie B and Soul II Soul. Narrated by Lauren Laverne. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Janice Long introduce performances by Sandie Shaw and the Smiths, Phil Collins, Belle and the Devotions, Bob Marley and the Wailers, Duran Duran, Julio Iglesias and Willie Nelson, Echo and the Bunnymen, the Flying Pickets and Lionel Richie.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The comedian concludes his road trip through the American South by exploring the musical heritage of Mississippi and Louisiana. In Memphis, he meets songwriting partners Steve Cropper and Eddie Floyd at Stax Records, before going on the trail of the origins of both delta and hill country blues in the company of musicians Seasick Steve and Cedric Burnside. His final port of call is New Orleans, where he meets Dr John, Irma Thomas and Allen Toussaint, three of the city's most celebrated artists. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Capability Brown's Unfinished Garden
programme.desc: Bunny Guinness tries to carry out the 18th-century English landscape designer's plans for his own garden in Fenstanton, Cambridgeshire. Brown travelled the length and breadth of the country, improving more than 200 of the greatest estates in the land, for some of the most influential people of the day, but the design for his own garden never got off the drawing board.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Stewart McPherson continues his quest to visit all of the UK's Overseas Territories. His second journey begins on Tristan da Cunha, the world's most remote inhabited island, and home to the entire world population of a spectacular albatross. From here, he travels to the Falkland Islands, coming face to face with a fearsomely intelligent bird of prey, and arrives in Stanley, the capital, in time for celebrations following the referendum in which the islanders decided overwhelmingly to remain part of Britain.(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City 2
programme.desc: What happens after you say, "I do?" It's been two years since Carrie Bradshaw and Big (Chris Noth) tied the knot. Now, somewhere between wild passion and a baby, they're feeling a little too much like "Mr. and Mrs. Married!" So when Carrie and her archetypal galpals take off on an all-expenses week in Abu Dhabi, they soon discover how much fun "forbidden" can be! Halfway across the world, she stumbles upon long-lost love Aidan (John Corbett), and even though she's convinced it means something, the girls think she's playing with fire. Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Kristin Davis, Cynthia Nixon and (all of) their men reunite with series executive producer Michael Patrick King in this follow-up to the $400+ million global box-office smash comedy about fashion, fun and friendship! programme.desc: Karen offends her stepdaughter, Olivia, during a shared Christmas break. Meanwhile, Grace attends a seasonal party at Will's mother's house, but accidentally breaks a treasured figurine and tries to blame another guest. Starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.desc: Robert's traffic-school students complain they are fed up with his class, so he resorts to teaching them using a puppet - an innovation that proves far from boring. American comedy, starring Brad Garrett and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.desc: A discovery makes Ray worry about his mortality - and prompts him to compile a list of things he wants to do before he dies. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.desc: The shrink worries he is being stalked by an unbalanced fan after receiving strange gifts with seemingly threatening messages attached. programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Worried that Martin has never expressed his love for them, Frasier and Niles join their father on a fishing trip in the hope that they can bond with him. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A caller to his radio show gives Frasier the impression Niles's wife Maris might be having an affair with her fencing instructor. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: President of Moe's Southwest Grill, Paul Damico, goes undercover to check the standards he values are still being met. The company is one of the world's fastest growing restaurant chains with 10,000 employees and Paul wants to look for opportunities to assist his staff in a similar way to how his family were helped by his father's bosses during his childhood.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Convinced the family no longer loves him, a dejected Santa's Little Helper decides to run away from home, and has the misfortune to be adopted by Mr Burns - who brainwashes him into becoming a vicious attack dog.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer goes to a Country and Western bar after a row with Marge, and vows to make the venue's singing waitress a star. As he throws himself into the role of manager, he realises he has to choose between his new career and his loyalty to his family. Featuring the voice of Beverly D'Angelo.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Colin and Mandy kick proceedings off in Bristol with a colourful and spicy assortment of courses, while their guests are treated to a night of conversation about romantic meetings, outrageous shirts and naked gardening. Next, PJ and Owen defy expectations and create a fancy menu, but their purple potato mash is more like play-doh, while Geoff and Gemma round things off with a hearty and rich selection of courses. Who will secure the £1000 prize?.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An international deal for James Constantinou on a wine collection in Lanzarote may be worth a million Euros, and a couple look to sell their one-of-a-kind house boat. Elsewhere, a gastro pub owner wants to take a loan out against a £250,000 Bentley, and James considers a risky deal on an unusual giant gemstone. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game as naturalist and broadcaster Kate Humble joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Quiz in which seven contestants are locked in a jury room and must work together to answer questions correctly and accumulate as much money as possible. It is the last chance for this group of jurors to win up to £10,000. However, a misunderstanding causes them to question who each can trust.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After 30 years of marriage and a life dedicated to their family, Simon and Mary Loyne feel the time has arrived to focus on themselves. They have sold their Cheshire home and cannot wait to move to Spain's Costa Almeria. Danni Menzies shows them five fabulous properties for their budget of £100,000, but do they go for a townhouse with a man cave Simon really wants or an apartment close to the beach, in Mary's perfect location?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In central Scotland, bakery assistant Jennifer hopes her night of hearty home cookery and cookie decorating will impress. She is joined by music producer Rory, operations manager Darren and drama coach Linsay. Night two sees Rory attempt to win over the crowd with his Swedish inspired grub and next up stylish Darren wows his guests. Linsay finishes the week with a trip to `retroville', but can she keep her bodily functions to herself?.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Doctors discover Homer has had a crayon lodged in his brain since childhood and decide to remove it. The procedure instantly transforms him into a genius, but removes his ability to enjoy life.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy is spooked when she wakes up to see DS Armstrong standing over her, and Zack finds looking after Daniel a bit overwhelming. Meanwhile, James tries to explain himself to DS Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Holiday Resort
programme.desc: Cameras monitor life at the all-inclusive Holiday World Resort in Malaga on Spain's Costa del Sol to take a warm-hearted look at what Britons get up in the sun and what it takes to keep them happy. Those featured include the Lloyd family from Northampton, including 12-year-old Danny whose singing and dancing proves a hit at the aquafit class. The Wades from Southend-on-Sea, Essex, are hoping to bond via the resort's all-inclusive entertainment - provided the children stop bickering, while James and Leanne from Preston battle the crowds during the morning stampede for the pool.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by celebrity guests for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The trio offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a fresh Top 50 countdown of hilarious and jaw-dropping internet clips in a celebration of the unfortunate, the misguided and the frankly just plain lacking in enough brain cells. Clips featured include the worst wedding intro ever, a girl with her head stuck in a pumpkin, and the `hot tub hair on fire' fail.(n)

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day
programme.desc: A man on a sailing holiday in Spain discovers his family have been abducted. His search for them leads him to learn that his father has been leading a double-life as a CIA agent, and has stolen top-secret information - which the kidnappers will stop at nothing to obtain. Thriller, starring Henry Cavill, Bruce Willis and Sigourney Weaver.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: The Royals have gathered at Balmoral, where Camilla is determined to exact revenge on Theresa May, who is in Scotland to stop Nicola Sturgeon destroying the union. Meanwhile, Charles is a hit with the Scots when it is revealed he has got no underwear on under his kilt, and Wills is shot by a wild Highland lassie, but who is the mysterious woman? Elsewhere, Meghan Markle is thrilled to get a part in Hollyoaks, but Pippa is determined to end Meghan and Harry's relationship. Starring Harry Enfield, Haydn Gwynne and Hugh Skinner.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: Janine is sentenced to a brutal punishment for her recent acts of disobedience, which leaves Offred and her fellow Handmaids faced with an unthinkable choice between her life and their own safety. Serena Joy discovers how her husband has been keeping secrets from her, while Moira makes a desperate journey to the Canadian border having escaped imprisonment in Jezebels. Conclusion of the dystopian drama based on Margaret Atwood's novel and starring Elisabeth Moss, Joseph Fiennes and Madeline Brewer. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the shows previous investigations. Kate heads to the Amazon rainforest to investigate rumours that the Brazil nuts on UK supermarket shelves are all radioactive. Meanwhile, Matt heads out on the streets to find out how the public feel about eating goat meat, and Jimmy takes to the skies above Israel to join the battle to protect the bell pepper crop from the Mediterranean fruit fly.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Single mother Jo Beck wants to move her family to Derby, despite her children being happily settled in Nottingham. Phil Spencer helps her decide if relocating is the right choice and searches for a suitable home. Also in Derby, Kirstie Allsopp offers advice to outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John Fairfield, who are looking for a property with a large garden, storage space for their sporting equipment and no noise from nearby roads.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three rival sellers in Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, compete to sell their homes to first-time buyer Helen, after snooping around each other's abodes and receiving £1,000 to make improvements. Jean and Max attend to their overflowing spare room and neglected garden, while Nina and Fred calm their lounge, and Rob and Sheryl update their bedrooms, in the hope of finally selling up.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: The transporters bid on a steel horse sculpture worth £95,000 which needs to be moved 96 miles from Hampshire to the Chelsea Flower Show in London. Laurie comes out on top, but she gets off to a faltering start due to an unfamiliar trailer. Plus, Shahbaz runs into trouble at the bronze statue drop-off, and Russell ends up spending a night at the zoo.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Action from the trail running event, a 97km race that climbed from the Atlantic coast to the summit of Mount Teide.(n)

programme.desc: Action from this year's staging of the event, which saw competitors try to set the fastest time over a 1000-yard course.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra clears out all the kids' old baby clothes and gives them to a jumble sale, making Ray realise she is resigned to not having any more children.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of two. Flashback episode in which the Barones recall their courtship and wedding, beginning with Ray's nervous marriage proposal - and subsequent uncertainty over Debra's motive for accepting.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Bebe advises Frasier to feign illness to secure a pay rise and prove he is indispensable, but the station responds by cleaning out his cubicle and auditioning for a replacement. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Harriet Sansom Harris.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Crane brothers buy into a restaurant, but their conflicting views on everything leave them without a head chef on opening night - and most of the waiters also walk out. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin prepares to celebrate his birthday, but an argument between Niles and Frasier over a patient, as well as a city-wide power cut, ensures none of the household is in the mood for a party. Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the 200th episode of the comedy, the gang finally celebrates Sheldon's birthday after more than nine years together, with the help of a few special guests. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with guest appearances from Adam West, Wil Wheaton and Stephen Hawking.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard face problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Plus, Penny, Amy and Bernadette give Raj dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and the family set off for a cheap break in Japan, where they get stranded and find themselves forced to take part in a shocking game show to win tickets for the flight home. Featuring the voice of Star Trek veteran George Takei.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer adopts a new identity and begins calling himself Max Power in a bid to avoid being confused with a bumbling TV cop who shares his real name. With the guest voice of Ed Begley Jr.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Newton House in Knaresborough, North Yorkshire, where Denise Carter and Jackie Fennell's traditional B&B focuses on organic, free-range breakfasts. Over dinner, guest Marianne Cammack and Deina Thomas from dominate the conversation, riling up some of the others, while Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson think the morning meal is all way too fancy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Highlands Pub in Blackpool, where managers Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson are all about value for money.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the White House in Brighton for the third day of the competition, where hosts Sean Edlin and Kathryn Turnbull run a laid-back seaside B&B. Denise and Jackie think the rooms are not well equipped and Marianne finds them clinical, while Mike and Neal are unsure about the price. Tensions are temporarily alleviated by a visit to the famous Theatre Royal, but Marianne and Deina continue to cause trouble at dinner. In the morning, a locally sourced breakfast impresses some of the guests, but the group must decide whether they are getting value for money.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wakes Hall Lodges near Colchester is the fourth and final visit of the week, where Neal and Mike are wowed by the five-star self-catering accommodation, complete with hot tubs and lakeside views. The others aren't so sure about the `luxury' breakfast hamper, however, especially as it means cooking their own. An afternoon of dog agility gives manager Marianne Cammack the chance to demonstrate her authority, although over dinner, her domineering conversation causes Jackie to finally snap.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Mike and Neal from the Highlands Pub challenge the comments that they were considered dirty and lacking in facilities, while Sean and Kathryn from the White House are left smarting after suffering large underpayments for what they think are minor issues. Eventually, the winner is finally revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Debbie and Tony Parkes have been married for 40 years, and are ready for a new chapter in their lives. With retirement around the corner, they've set their hearts on a holiday home in Albufeira on Portugal's Algarve with a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: Two Huddersfield sisters plan to create high-end student accommodation on a budget of £100,000, while in south-east London, £35,000 turns a two-bedroom terrace into a family home.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Alcorn family in Peebles in the Scottish Borders. The family of four lives in a conservation area and while dad Dave loves their grey-stone Victorian villa for its picture-book charm, mum Amy despises its lack of practicality. With no off-road parking, no third bedroom and no downstairs bathroom - not to mention the small, draughty kitchen - she has quite a list. Would it be best to simply move on to one of the new properties picked out by Phil, or can Kirstie come up with a way of making their home work?.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Britain at Low Tide
programme.desc: Tori Herridge and Alex Langlands set out to document Britain's industrial and natural maritime history, using state-of-the-art technology to comb the nation's exposed coastlines during times of low tide. They first head out to the Northumbrian coastline, to investigate the tragic story of a French fishing trawler that was wrecked off shore in 1913.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: New series. The first of three programmes in which the veteran TV presenter delves into the rich vein of cinematic history to find out what it takes to transform a film into a silver-screen masterpiece capable to standing the test of time. Taking in everything from big production musicals to vehicles for enduring screen heroines, Paul reveals what makes celebrated movies so memorable. He begins with classic `weepies', from the early silent melodramas through to James Cameron's Titanic, and hears from Jon Voight, Bernard Cribbins, Celine Dion and the casts of E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial and Beaches.(n)

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: A retired CIA agent survives an assassination attempt and realises something in his past has made him a target. He sets out to reunite the members of his old hit squad to find out who is trying to kill them and why, but in the process, uncovers dangerous secrets. Action thriller, with Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich and Helen Mirren.(n)

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim Levenstein and his old friends return to their home town for a high-school reunion. Struck by how much their lives have changed, they set out to relive the sexual misadventures of their adolescence, but only end up making bigger fools of themselves than they did as teenagers. Comedy sequel to the American Pie movies, starring Jason Biggs and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.desc: Alma is unhappy with her little carrot patch, so the friends set off across the desert in the camper van to Fantastic Gardens, where vegetables grow as big as trees.(n)

programme.desc: Children's animation about a young rabbit.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive ape is given a chance to see the sights of the city from the river. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rusty Rivets

programme.desc: Grizel is tired of her cold and draughty home, and comes up with a cunning plan to take over Fizzy's Mushroom Cottage.(n)

programme.desc: Dr Hamster's pet tortoise Tiddles becomes stuck up a tree and needs rescuing.(n)

programme.title: Mofy

programme.desc: The aliens are baffled when strange, musical noises start to occur whenever Mr Hooman is in the shower.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
