programme.title: Self-Portrait
programme.desc: Actors and directors discuss their thoughts on film-making.(n)

programme.title: Millions
programme.desc: A bag of stolen money falls from the sky, and wide-eyed youngster Damian thinks it is a gift from God. However, his level-headed brother realises they must race against time to spend the loot before the country switches to the Euro and a robber on their tail catches up with them. Comedy drama, starring Alex Etel, Lewis McGibbon, Daisy Donovan and James Nesbitt.(n)

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine O'Hara and John Candy.(n)

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk.(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton.(n)

programme.title: Red State
programme.desc: Three teenagers are lured to a remote area by an online offer of sex, only to fall into the clutches of a fanatical Christian sect. The preacher leading the group is on a mission to kill all those he judges as sinners, but his actions have been noticed by the local sheriff, and the church is soon under siege by federal agents. Thriller, starring Michael Parks and John Goodman.(n)

programme.title: Safety Not Guaranteed
programme.desc: A magazine writer and two interns are sent to investigate a mysterious personal ad claiming to be from a time traveller seeking someone to join him on a trip into the past. While the journalist is distracted by tracking down an old flame, one of his assistants identifies the writer of the message and volunteers to join his expedition. Sci-fi comedy, starring Aubrey Plaza and Mark Duplass.(n)

programme.title: ParaNorman
programme.desc: A misunderstood boy is able to communicate with ghosts haunting his neighbourhood, but no one else believes they exist. When a curse placed on the town by a witch centuries ago causes zombies to rise from the grave, it falls to the youngster to avert disaster. Animated adventure, with the voices of Kodi Smit-McPhee and John Goodman.(n)

programme.title: The Boxtrolls
programme.desc: The people of a small town live in fear of underground trolls, which they do not realise are actually harmless. A boy raised by the creatures must convince the townsfolk there is nothing to fear when a team of pest exterminators is hired to wipe out the friendly monsters. Stop-motion animated fantasy, with the voices of Isaac Hempstead Wright, Elle Fanning and Ben Kingsley. Includes Lotto.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cleo
programme.desc: A captured Briton is mistaken for a heroic swordsman and promoted to the Roman Royal Guard, with orders to protect Julius Caesar. But the last thing he and the fated emperor expect is an assassination attempt from within Caesar's own circle of friends. Comedy, starring Amanda Barrie, Kenneth Williams, Sid James, Kenneth Connor, Jim Dale, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: The eccentric spectre-hunters reunite to save New York from a massive river of slime generated by the citizens' negativity and nasty thoughts. Meanwhile, the spirit of a 16th-century tyrant tries to return to the land of the living by possessing the body of a toddler. Sequel to the supernatural comedy, starring Bill Murray, Sigourney Weaver, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis and Ernie Hudson.(n)

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: A repairman is assigned to salvage the remaining resources from Earth, which has been left a devastated wasteland after a war with an alien race. He discovers a human survivor on the surface of the planet, an encounter that exposes secrets from the past that threaten the future of the human race. Sci-fi adventure, starring Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: The Pyramid
programme.desc: Premiere. A previously unexplored pyramid is discovered in the Egyptian desert, and a party of archaeologists sets out to uncover its secrets. The explorers soon find the tomb is riddled with deadly traps, but this proves the least of their worries when they realise it was built to contain dark forces that they have now unleashed. Horror, starring Ashley Hinshaw and Denis O'Hare.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten cooks for a friend and makes roasted pea soup, red pepper and goat's cheese sandwiches, with carrot and pineapple cake for dessert.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten holds a party for the team who helped create her dream barn, and makes smoked salmon with herbed butter.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares two lunches, with recipes including warm duck salad and blueberry crumb cake.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten cooks a lunch of swordfish steaks in tomato caper sauce, saffron and courgette couscous followed by individual chocolate puddings.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates a selection of recipes which can be made in advance, including a roasted vegetable lasange with four cheeses.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: A selection of cheese recipes, including a cheddar beer soup, and a giant ricotti and spinach ravioli with sage butter.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: As head of the fashion design agency Judy Inc., David Clemmer falls short in the taste department. Ezra and Julie dress up the agency's menu repertoire with easy, no-cook recipes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes spicy jerk chicken and a crunchy corn salad.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes a basic chicken salad with grapes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes hearty rib-eye quesadillas and spicy perfect pinto beans.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her dad's retirement with a meal of all his favourite foods, including slow-cooked burgundy beef stew and mini chocolate-cherry cakes.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: To celebrate the 100th birthday of world-famous children's author Roald Dahl, four bakers compete to have their cake at the centre of the party.(n)

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.sub-title: From The Garden To The Sea And Back To Mum's Kitchen.
programme.desc: Jono calls on Antony to help him build a funky glass house, and Poh cooks the boys lunch and goes fishing.(n)

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh and Sara develop three unique ice cream flavours, and back home, Poh whips up a batch of butter chicken and leaves it on the doorstep of her neighbour.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The four winning chefs prepare to serve their dishes to an expectant audience of wartime heroes at the banquet at St Paul's Cathedral commemorating the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. They get a nasty shock when they first arrive at the venue and discover the kitchens aren't quite up to the highest standards, but judges Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort help rectify the situation - although the delay forces one of the chefs to work long into the night.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: As the guys are away, Ree Drummond makes a blueberry crumb cake for breakfast, and petite filets with wasabi cilantro cream, lobster mac and cheese and lemony broccolini for dinner.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up a celebration dinner for her husband's birthday, with chili cheese burgers, crisp thin fries, a wedge salad and a yellow cake with a chocolate buttercream frosting.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers battle to have their amazing creations as the centrepiece of the Addams Family party, but only one will take home the $10,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman searches for London's hidden delights, including a sundae you can only buy if you dance first and a speakeasy disguised as a detective agency.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman heads to Argentina, where he samples French toast from a steampunk speakeasy, an off-menu Mendozan stew served in a pumpkin, and lamb loin from a secret restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger meets chef Johnny Hernandez in San Antonio and cooks regional Mexican dishes.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking is makes his way through Texas for live-fire Latin American cooking and to savour the flavours of smoked European-style sausages.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actress Sienna Miller shares her recipe for Tuscan duck ragu, Jamie Oliver cooks a whole salmon in salt and Jimmy Doherty creates a DIY hog roast for the ultimate crackling. Jimmy and Jamie also try to revive the fortunes of the little-known tosset cake, a biscuit associated with the village of Stalmine in Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: When Joe and Gene opened Somers 202 it was popular among locals. However after being open for four years the business has not been as successful and Willie Degel steps in.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Cara is concerned about unhealthy competition between her two New Orleans restaurants, Toast and Tartine. The Mystery Diners go undercover and make a surprising discovery.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Kristy and Sarah from Moviesets in New Orleans are concerned about theft at their event centre. Mystery Diners Rob and Ingrid book a wedding reception and make a discovery.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern makes some tasty new discoveries in Cleveland.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: When chef Robert Irvine meets Jordan, the self-described stubborn owner of the Portu-Greek Cafe in Hudson, Florida, he knows that he is in for a challenge.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Pelons Tex-Mex Restaurant in Austin, Texas contacts Charles for advice after hearing rumours that his staff are collecting money for an unauthorised charity.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Danny and Jonathan, owners of the Old School Bar and Grill in Texas, are concerned about a loss of revenue on their poetry nights, so Charles sends in Justin and Samantha to investigate the causes of the reduction.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten rustles up some blue cheese burgers and East Hampton clam chowder for an outdoor party.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a meal for her husband, including aubergine gratin and peanut swirl brownies.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten makes Mexican chicken soup and chocolate orange fondue while her husband is away.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten goes for dinner at a friend's new waterside fishing shack.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond celebrates her and her husband's anniversary by preparing a Colorado wedge salad, prime rib for five with chimichurri, and rustic country bread with honey butter.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares various meatless meals, including broccoli cheese baked potatoes, grilled aubergine steaks, roasted vegetable panzanella, Italian cornbread and tofu lettuce wraps.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes dinner for her family, preparing a menu of spicy slow cooked ribs, cheesy hominy casserole, broccoli salad and ice cream layer cake.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes five ingredient meals, including a chicken fennel bake, spaghetti carbonara, eggs in tomatoes, veggie tortellini soup and three varieties of baking tray suppers.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The travelling chef heads for New York, shunning the glamour of Manhattan to discover an underground gastronomic subculture run by some of the Big Apple's most colourful culinary personalities. In Queens, he meets a pioneer of Egyptian-style home-cooked food, and discovers two home-run restaurants providing the city's diners with exotic dishes at economy prices.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: During a visit to Cleveland, Ohio, Adam Richman tries to finish the Melt Bar and Grilled restaurant's 5lb grilled-cheese sandwich challenge.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman heads to Phoenix, Arizona, and goes against the clock when he tries to devour 12 slider-style hamburgers with onion rings in half an hour.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Boulder, Colorado, where he takes on the West End Wing King Challenge and must eat a bucket of 50 buffalo wings to achieve success.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food

programme.title: Man v Food

programme.desc: At New York's Port Royal Pub and Grille, Adam Richman tackles the Davy Jones Locker Challenge, a huge platter of seafood that only one person has ever finished.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tries the Ultimate Destroyer Challenge at Papa Bob's Bar-B-Que in Kansas City, where he must eat a foot-long sandwich containing 5lb of smoked meat in 45 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Indianapolis to try the Big Ugly Burger Challenge at Bub's Burger Ice Cream.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Syracuse, New York, Adam Richman takes on the Frittata Challenge - a breakfast dish weighing more than 6lb.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Harvey decides that if Diana and Tom are seen to be mentally incompetent it will give him power of attorney over their affairs and end all his woes. However, the couple are wise to him, and plan a well-orchestrated display for the visiting psychiatrist. Comedy, with Graham Crowden, Stephanie Cole and Daniel Hill.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: A councillor trying to win the election by attracting the OAP vote incurs Diana's wrath. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin is overjoyed when Paul announces he is leaving the area as he cannot find suitable premises for his business, but later faces a quandry when he changes upon an available property in the ideal location. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: The new gents' toilets are opened by Sebastian Coe, and Gordon prepares for Life Cycle week at the centre. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream.
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell.
programme.desc: When Clegg, Billy and Truly hear an old school friend is about to die, the trio search for something - or someone - to put the spark back into his life. Comedy, guest starring Henry McGee, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Keith Clifford.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: As Barry tires of golf and looks for a new hobby, Billy's latest idea of an archery course is right on target. Long-running comedy series, starring Mike Grady, Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin is overjoyed when Paul announces he is leaving the area as he cannot find suitable premises for his business, but later faces a quandry when he changes upon an available property in the ideal location. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: The new gents' toilets are opened by Sebastian Coe, and Gordon prepares for Life Cycle week at the centre. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom sets out to catch the thief responsible for stealing leeks from his garden, but ends up landing himself in trouble. Self-sufficiency comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy cannot believe his ears when Rodney tells him he has found a girlfriend. The trouble is, the woman is old enough to be his mother - and to make matters worse, her husband is about to be released from prison.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas proves a depressing time for Del-Boy as he tries to get over another failed romance, but he soon bounces back after finding a new lady friend. The problem is she also has a son. Christmas special from 1982, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: The staff at Bayview Retirement Village are sent into a panic when Diana and Tom head off to Brighton for the day in a borrowed Porshe without telling anyone. Comedy, starring Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Feature-length Christmas special from 2001. A veteran actress is shot through the heart during the filming of a darkly surreal love story, but the bullet appears to have passed through a plate-glass window without breaking it. With Maddy out of the country, Jonathan is lumbered with a pushy theatrical agent who has a nose for mystery. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies, Julia Sawalha, Steven Berkoff, Mary Tamm and Jay Benedict.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy goes to extreme lengths to impress her psychologist boyfriend, much to Agnes's disgust, while Rory locates the perfect apartment for him and Dino - the problem is, it's in Kilbride, meaning he'll have to learn to drive. Mark prepares to emigrate to Australia. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Vince and Howard need inspiration if they are to secure a record deal, so Naboo tells them the tale of two musical gurus who defended a town full of women from the evil Betamax Bandit. Guest starring Alice Lowe (Sightseers), the Who frontman Roger Daltrey and Razorlight.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Vince and Howard hold a seance in a bid to impress two goth girls. However, their dabbling in the spirit realm summons up the most evil demon known to man, which promptly makes off with one of Naboo's magic books. With the livid shaman too drunk to retrieve the mystic tome, it falls to the hapless pair to prevent the end of the world. Richard Ayoade (The IT Crowd) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Falconhoof deals with a caller keen to send him back `whence he came' and Jacqueline McCafferty may have finally found true love. Plus, find out what happens to a small community when its famous children's television show Dream Scheme is cancelled and Limmy uses all his powers of deduction to fathom which door is the one for the gents toilet.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Falconhoof introduces smelly-vision into his Adventure Call quest, while Dee Dee has the night of his life after stumbling upon a bin bag full of goodies outside a charity shop . Plus, can you really escape all your problems by flying up into the clouds? Comedy sketches, written by and starring Brian Limond.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve Coogan is commissioned to review half a dozen restaurants for a Sunday newspaper and plans the trip with his American girlfriend - only to face the prospect of a week of meals-for-one after she dumps him. So Steve calls old friend Rob Brydon to accompany him, and the pair find themselves debating the big questions of life over a series of delightful dishes. Improvised comedy in which the stars play versions of themselves, directed by Michael Winterbottom.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve and Rob enjoy a taster menu at L'Enclume in the Cumbrian village of Cartmel as they continue their culinary tour of the north of England, reviewing restaurants for a Sunday newspaper. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Following the death of a resident, Tom puts himself forward as a counsellor to aid and comfort the terminally ill. Meanwhile, Jane becomes confused when she overhears Tom and Diana's discussion over the existence of God. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The first ever episode of John Sullivan's classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1981, which introduced the viewing public to the Trotter family. Rodney grows tired of being dogsbody to wheeler-dealing older brother Del-Boy and decides to set out on his own. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney make a bit of cash on a used-car deal and decide to celebrate in style with a night out in the West End. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets his hands on a statue of a Hindu god - which plunges him into the middle of an age-old feud between rival families. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del spots another sure-fire winner and decides to enter the highly profitable tourist trade - and with Rodney and Grandad backing him 100 per cent, he is sure his open-top bus tour initiative will be a massive success. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy acquires three tons of lead sheeting, which turns out to be a DIY nuclear fallout shelter, so he, Rodney and Grandad collect their sleeping bags and food and have a practice run to make sure they will know what to do if the Russians attack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets the chance to sell off a couple of antique urns - the only problem being that one of them contains the ashes of Trigger's late grandfather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Lennard Pearce and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Fish
programme.desc: Keith Floyd dredges for scallops in Dorset before heading to the George Hotel in Bridport to cook them. He also rustles up a bass dish with Rick Stein at the chef's seafood restaurant in Padstow.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: The chef returns to Seoul in time for Chuseok, the three-day harvest festival. He also learns about Buddhist cuisine and makes Korean glass noodles.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The best six chefs from the week battle it out in the third quarter-final, in which the judges test their pastry skills. First they ask them to make a sweet dish of their own invention from 10 ingredients including a fresh coconut, passionfruit, white chocolate and rum. After a double elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Tracey MacLeod, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the knockout week.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: In the second heat, four more bakers are challenged by presenter Aaron Craze to prepare jammy shortbread biscuits, before demonstrating their own recipes for a chocolate celebration cake.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King travel the country to examine the UK's obsession with teatime treats. They make Bakewell tart in its original Derbyshire home and prepare a Victoria sandwich for the ladies of the WI. At Henley regatta, the duo prepare cookies with sour cherries and chocolate chips, and later serve afternoon tea to the Tees Rowing Club.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Fantastical Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal aims to rekindle people's love of traditional pub food by building a giant pie and transforming it into a fully functioning public house in the Welsh village of Minera. But that's not all - his tavern comes complete with a billiard table made from cod, tartare sauce and pea mousse - topped off with pickled egg balls - a supersized pork scratching big enough to feed the entire village and a fruit machine that pays its jackpot in snacks.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that summer has to offer, rustling up dishes using the finest available seasonal produce. In the first episode, he visits a local farm that produces welfare-friendly animals, exploring the reasons why members of the British public often feel uneasy about eating veal. He also visits Manchester to extol the success of land-linking website Landshare.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Tim Maddams introduce a `leftovers night' at the canteen, turning a range of foods destined for the compost heap into new dishes including gnocchi, fish canapes and puddings made from breadcrumbs. A visit to Portland Young Offender Institution reveals the success of its vegetable-growing programme, and a nursery-school teacher is shown how to bake bread.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall finds slugs have started eating his soft cabbages in the garden, so he plans to include them on his menu, and there is disappointment ahead when the chef learns his goat has had a phantom pregnancy. Hugh accepts a fishing-cooking-racing challenge and also visits Portland Young Offenders' Institution, where he learns that part of the inmates' rehabilitation programme involves them growing their own vegetables.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall gets preparations for the strawberry fete under way with his gardeners, planting seeds in every available place to ensure large crop yields. The chef spends an evening fishing for river trout as he gathers ideas for what to serve his guests, and apprentice Sarah Bilson is challenged to prepare the perfect sweet scone to earn her place in the baking team.(n)

programme.desc: The Beef. In the series premiere, Diplo gets in a Twitter war with Calvin Harris(n)

programme.title: People Just Do Nothing
programme.desc: Weed Drought. Grindah and Beats find themselves in the midst of a weed drought and decide to take matters into their own hands. Chabuddy G prepares to sell his stock of counterfeit designer t-shirts at the market. At the salon, Miche clashes with one of her colleagues(n)

programme.title: People Just Do Nothing
programme.desc: Promotion. Chabuddy prepares for his latest business venture and Grindah has a big announcement for Miche. Meanwhile, Beats takes Craig on a father and son fishing trip(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: In this terrifying horror sequel, husband-and-wife paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren help a single mother living in 1977 London, who claims that she and her children are being terrorized by supernatural forces(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver learns the world of auto racing is fixed in this adrenaline-charged, live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Jules Verne fantasy, Brendan Fraser plays Trevor Anderson, an ambitious science professor who develops an unconventional hypothesis that elicits laughter within the academic community. But, when his teenage nephew, Sean, shows up to spend the summer with him, they both embark on a magical journey that will bring Trevor the answers he was looking for. In a box that belonged to his missing brother, Max, Trevor finds a book with references to Max's last journey. He decides to follow his brother's steps and, along with Sean, travels to Iceland. There, a major scientific discovery miles beneath the surface of the Earth will introduce them not only to a strange new world but also to alien like creatures that appear to be from a completely different planet(n)

programme.desc: An estranged family reunite over the holidays for the first time since the death of their matriarch(n)

programme.title: In Vogue: The Editor's Eye
programme.desc: Exquisite documentary coinciding with Vogue's 120th anniversary, with special focus falling on the fashion editors past and present who have forged the magazine's legacy(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: While Christmas shopping in New York for their respective partners, Jonathan and Sara meet by chance and fall in love before the day is over. At the end of the evening, Sara jumps in a cab and leaves, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed bring them back together and they rekindle their love(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy are a chalk-and-cheese couple who fall in love and marry. Now, all they need for the union to work is to survive both families who disapprove of the match, deal with the well-meaning friends who meddle too much and, on their honeymoon, suffer a selection of Europe's worst accommodation. Shawn Levy's romantic comedy, although occasionally succumbing to America's view of Europe, is held together by the two leads, particularly Murphy's unexpected gift for comedy(n)

programme.title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert
programme.desc: Fans of Miley Cyrus and her pop-star alter ego on her series Hannah Montana get the best of both worlds with this live concert film. Shot during her 54-city musical tour, this concert captures Cyrus performing both as herself and as Hannah. She perform a handful of song with The Jonas Brothers. THe directors also include footage of the performers backstage. The film is presented in Disney Digital 3-D, providing the most realistic concert experience possible(n)

programme.title: Garfield: The Movie
programme.desc: Jim Davis' famous cartoon cat finally makes his way to the big screen in this adaptation of the popular comic strip Garfield, which combines live action with CGI animation. Jon Arbuckle (Breckin Meyer) is a sweet, if somewhat clueless, man who shares his home with his pet cat, Garfield (voice of Bill Murray). Garfield is not your ordinary tabby -- he's fat, he's smart-mouthed, he's arrogant, he won't do anything he doesn't have to, and would rather stuff himself with lasagna than do something Jon asks of him. Despite this, Jon loves his cat, but when he decides to expand his animal family, Garfield is less than enthusiastic about the presence of Odie, a lovably enthusiastic dog whose only flaw is his extreme stupidity. While Jon is crazy for Odie, and especially likes having two pets that necessitate periodic visits to Dr. Liz Wilson (Jennifer Love Hewitt), a veterinarian he has a crush on, Garfield decides to remove Odie from the picture. Garfield arranges for Odie to become the property of Happy Chapman (Stephen Tobolowsky), a television host who acts like an animal lover on the round-cornered screen but doesn't much like pets on his own time. While Garfield at first enjoys ruling the roost again, he soon realizes the error of his ways, and in a rare example of selfless and ambitious behavior, hatches a plan to rescue Odie from Chapman. Garfield also features the voice talents of Debra Messing, Brad Garrett, Jimmy Kimmel, and Alan Cumming(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs. Aliens
programme.desc: When evil aliens led by Gallaxhar threaten to take over Earth, the U.S. government unleashes the only fighting force capable of stopping them---a motley crew of monsters that they've been hiding away for decades(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: Hello Rudy. Abby is excited to meet her new stepbrother, Rudy, for the first time, so Rosita and Elmo help her keep an eye out for him(n)

programme.desc: Battle of the Chefs. Chris and Elmo help Alan compete in "Cast Iron Cook" challenges(n)

programme.desc: On a class trip to Rome, Lizzie is asked to join Italian pop sensations Paolo and Isabella for a Colosseum gig. She's desperate to sing, but can she outwit her teacher Miss Ungermeyer?(n)

African-American Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's colour barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history(n)

programme.desc: Nearly 20 years after her death, Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, recall their mother's influence on their lives, her public persona and her humanitarian work as they leaf through a private family album(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Two decades after being kicked out of a famous heavy-metal group, a failed fortysomething drummer gets a second chance to rock when he joins his teen nephew's band. Rainn Wilson ("The Office") stars in this hilarious, feel-good comedy from Peter Cattaneo, the director of "The Full Monty." Christina Applegate, Josh Gad, Teddy Geiger, Emma Stone(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad

Jared Leto makes a cameo appearance as the Joker. Joel Kinnaman and Viola Davis co-star. Based on the DC Comics series(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. Tim Meadows, Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, and Imogen Poots co-star. Samberg, Taccone, and Schaffer co-wrote the screenplay, while Taccone and Schaffer shared directing duties(n)

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Fox Searchlight presents the tragic life story of rap star Notorious B.I.G. from director George Tillman Jr. (Soul Food) and executive producer Sean "Diddy" Combs. The script is provided by Cheo Hodari Coker and Biker Boyz writer/director Reggie Rock Blythewood. Jamal Woolard portrays the slain rapper, with Angela Bassett, Derek Luke, and Anthony Mackie filling out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Drama starring Queen Latifah and Dakota Fanning, set in South Carolina during the turbulent struggle for civil rights in the early 60s. Fourteen-year-old Lily Owens is seeking to escape the clutches of her abusive father and find some relief from the haunting memories of her mother's death. In her attempt to find peace, she flees to the comforting, supportive, empowering environment created by August Boatwright and her sisters, May, and June. There, she finds a sense of purpose in looking after the sisters' bees, romance with local boy Zach and a fuller understanding of her mother's past(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institutes's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: After a tragic accident kills his bride-to-be, the grieving would-be groom turns to a local psychic to help him through the pain. However, when romance blossoms between the pair, the spirit of his late partner resolves to ruin their relationship from beyond the grave(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster stars in this taut thriller from the director of Se7en and Fight Club. A wealthy divorcee and her diabetic daughter purchase a luxury New York apartment, complete with a state-of-the-art 'panic room'. On their first night in the apartment, intruders break in, causing the mother and daughter to flee to the safety of the secret chamber. The problem is that what the intruders are looking for is to be found in the 'panic room'. To make matters worse, the daughter quickly needs an insulin shot or she'll die. Also starring Jared Leto and Forest Whitaker(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Diana, Our Mother: Her Life and Legacy
programme.desc: Nearly 20 years after her death, Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, recall their mother's influence on their lives, her public persona and her humanitarian work as they leaf through a private family album(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Three student filmmakers are terrorized in the Maryland forest while making a documentary about a legendary 18th-century witch. Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Michael Williams star. Directed by Eduardo Sanchez and Daniel Myrick(n)

programme.title: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
programme.desc: A portrait of Hollywood royalty Carrie Fisher (1956-2016) and her mother, Debbie Reynolds (1932-2016), who speak candidly about their lives in the limelight, the ups and downs of celebrity and their intimate bond on a shared compound in Beverly Hills(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel written by Alan Moore (the genre's High Priest), directed by Zach Snyder. It's 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the VIetnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot..(n)

programme.desc: A rich Wall Street player basks in his late-1980s yuppie lifestyle, but behind his slick appearance lurks a murderous monster(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This reimagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He attempts to use this power to bring about the fall of his female boss. But as he uses this inside knowledge to outwit his superior, the bachelor begins to fall in love with her, and so finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks like it may come to fruition(n)

programme.desc: A tough cop must protect a witness set to testify against a homicidal cult leader, but a mole in the department makes the job more difficult that he expects(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Fox Searchlight presents the tragic life story of rap star Notorious B.I.G. from director George Tillman Jr. (Soul Food) and executive producer Sean "Diddy" Combs. The script is provided by Cheo Hodari Coker and Biker Boyz writer/director Reggie Rock Blythewood. Jamal Woolard portrays the slain rapper, with Angela Bassett, Derek Luke, and Anthony Mackie filling out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Drama starring Queen Latifah and Dakota Fanning, set in South Carolina during the turbulent struggle for civil rights in the early 60s. Fourteen-year-old Lily Owens is seeking to escape the clutches of her abusive father and find some relief from the haunting memories of her mother's death. In her attempt to find peace, she flees to the comforting, supportive, empowering environment created by August Boatwright and her sisters, May, and June. There, she finds a sense of purpose in looking after the sisters' bees, romance with local boy Zach and a fuller understanding of her mother's past(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institutes's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: After a tragic accident kills his bride-to-be, the grieving would-be groom turns to a local psychic to help him through the pain. However, when romance blossoms between the pair, the spirit of his late partner resolves to ruin their relationship from beyond the grave(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster stars in this taut thriller from the director of Se7en and Fight Club. A wealthy divorcee and her diabetic daughter purchase a luxury New York apartment, complete with a state-of-the-art 'panic room'. On their first night in the apartment, intruders break in, causing the mother and daughter to flee to the safety of the secret chamber. The problem is that what the intruders are looking for is to be found in the 'panic room'. To make matters worse, the daughter quickly needs an insulin shot or she'll die. Also starring Jared Leto and Forest Whitaker(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Diana, Our Mother: Her Life and Legacy
programme.desc: Nearly 20 years after her death, Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, recall their mother's influence on their lives, her public persona and her humanitarian work as they leaf through a private family album(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Three student filmmakers are terrorized in the Maryland forest while making a documentary about a legendary 18th-century witch. Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Michael Williams star. Directed by Eduardo Sanchez and Daniel Myrick(n)

programme.title: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
programme.desc: A portrait of Hollywood royalty Carrie Fisher (1956-2016) and her mother, Debbie Reynolds (1932-2016), who speak candidly about their lives in the limelight, the ups and downs of celebrity and their intimate bond on a shared compound in Beverly Hills(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel written by Alan Moore (the genre's High Priest), directed by Zach Snyder. It's 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the VIetnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot..(n)

programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama, a remake of George Cukor's 1939 satire, from writer-director Diane English. Mary Haines thinks she has it all - a happy marriage, a lovely daughter, a top clothes designer job at her father's firm and a solid circle of very good friends. But then she hears through the grapevine that her husband is having an affair with a perfume saleswoman and, with that one thread unpicked, her entire world begins to unravel… Also starring Debra Messing, Jada Pinkett Smith, Candice Bergen, Cloris Leachman, Bette Midler and Carrie Fisher(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: D.L. Hughley. Strong language and sexual material punctuate this routine by D.L. Hughley. Taped before a Miami Beach audience, the comic addresses money and dating, his upbringing, and not being a hero(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: Corrupt exec Arthur Herk is trying to buy a nuclear bomb. Russian mobsters want the weapon, and two hitmen arrive in Miami to take him out. Add hippies, sarcastic kids and a lorryload of goats for a chaotic comedy(n)

programme.title: Moon over Parador
programme.desc: While working in a small nation on the Caribbean, an American actor (Richard Dreyfuss) is convinced by the chief of police (Raul Julia) to impersonate the nation's dictator who has recently passed away. The actor really begins to enjoy the role after a while, thanks in part to the dictator's mistress (Sonia Braga)(n)

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: Farce in which a convicted petty thief who escapes from jail finds a filofax belonging to an uptight executive and decides to track down the owner and claim the promised $1,000 reward for its return, but he quickly finds himself mistaken for the owner. The crook is whisked off on the adman's hectic schedule, leaving the real high flyer stranded without money or contacts on the dangerous streets of Los Angeles(n)

programme.title: Tracey Ullman's Show
programme.desc: Epsiode 5. Kate Middleton's mother babysits Prince George; Maggie Smith mulls an action movie franchise; a zookeeper misses her favorite monkey; American tourists see a darker side of Britain; a vicar is late for a funeral and turns to social media for help(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.desc: In this sequel, illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: A successful self-help author comes home for a visit, only to find his mother engaged to his sadistic former gym teacher. Billy Bob Thornton, Susan Sarandon and Seann William Scott star in this outrageous farce. Directed by Craig Gillespie(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Amazing true crime story about teenage con man Frank Abagnale Jr - who cashed fake cheques worth over $2.5m while disguised as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer - and the FBI agent who caught him(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Comedy about a disgruntled chauffeur who kidnaps his boss' beloved dog but finds himself being suspected as the victim in the case when the canny canine gets away. When the dog returns home, the mistress becomes convinced that it is the chauffeur himself who is the victim of a terrible crime(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: A successful self-help author comes home for a visit, only to find his mother engaged to his sadistic former gym teacher. Billy Bob Thornton, Susan Sarandon and Seann William Scott star in this outrageous farce. Directed by Craig Gillespie(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Action comedy about an undercover cop who befriends a petty criminal in order to get to a bigger target - drug baron James Caan. But with the target in sight, things begin to go disastrously but hilariously wrong!(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jimmy Tong is a well-meaning but clumsy New York City cab driver who is tapped by Steena, associate to multi-millionaire Clark Devlin, for a new job as Devlin's personal limo driver. After a mysterious accident lands Devlin in the hospital, Tong learns that his new boss has a secret -- when he's not wheeling and dealing in high finance, Devlin is also a secret agent for the CSA, a top-level security agency(n)

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: After their mother passes away, four estranged siblings return home to attend the traditional funeral she wanted(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
programme.desc: Christina Applegate stars in this convoluted comedy that comes across as a teen fantasy combination of Home Alone and Working Girl. The premise is all in the title -- when the mother (Concetta Tomei) of a sniveling group of surly kids goes on a much-deserved summer vacation, she leaves her kids under the charge of an elderly distaff granny (Eda Reiss Merin). When granny ups and dies, the kids load her dead body in a trunk and deposit the package on the steps of the local funeral home. The kids are ecstatic thinking that with the big wad of cash Mom has left, they can have a summer of consumer madness. But when they find out that the money has been buried with the baby-sitter, the kids have to fend for themselves to make ends meet. Dream teen Sue Ellen (Christina Applegate) tries working at a fast food restaurant but she can't stand the grease. So, she puts together a false resume and, posing as a twenty-eight-year old, she applies for a job as a receptionist at a garment manufacturing company. The company vice president, Rose (Joanna Cassidy), is so impressed by her resume that she hires her on the spot as her executive assistant. Her deception looks to be working out great -- Sue Ellen manages to hold off the office lady killer Gus (John Getz), avoids exposure by the embittered receptionist, borrows money from the company's petty cash box for household incidentals, and continues her relationship with restaurant employee Bryan (Josh Charles). But suddenly, the clothing firm is set to go under, and Sue Ellen must use her teen fashion sense to save the company and her job . . . and she has to get the rest of the brood involved(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: This feel-good ensemble comedy tracks a quartet of suburban siblings and their families over the course of a single summer. Hardworking Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his stay-at-home wife, Karen (Mary Steeenburgen), have just a few months to help their oldest son, Kevin (Jasen Fisher), overcome his high-strung behavior problems before he'll be relegated to special-education classes. Gil's difficult relationship with his own father, Frank (Jason Robards), has led him to become a would-be super-dad for his three kids, so he takes his son's difficulties more than a little personally. Gil's sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is trying to raise a moody, adolescent son (Leaf Phoenix) and an independent-minded daughter (Martha Plimpton) with no help from her well-off ex-husband, who's more interested in his new wife and family. Gil and Helen's sister, Susan (Harley Jane Kozak), meanwhile, must participate in the too-scripted Big Life Plans of her anal-retentive husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), whose overachiever zeal infects even their toddler daughter. When long-lost brother Larry (Tom Hulce) show up with yet another get-rich-quick scheme, he brings with him a surprise addition to the family. Screenwriters Babaloo Mandel, Lowell Ganz, and Ron Howard negotiate their varied subplots with a deftness and comedic touch that transforms this conflicted clan into a suburban everyfamily(n)

programme.title: Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted
programme.desc: Comedian Tig Notaro performs at the Wilbur Theatre in Boston. Topics include doing shows in Las Vegas; introducing her fiancée to her family in Mississippi; TSA screenings; small planes; Santa Claus; and misleading text messages. Taped May 31, 2015(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: London's most frequently eligible bachelor gets some lessons in growing up from a maladroit 12-year-old boy in this third big-screen adaptation of a Nick Hornby novel, directed and co-written by siblings Chris and Paul Weitz of American Pie fame. About a Boy concerns the parallel coming-of-age stories of the thirtysomething Will (Hugh Grant), a layabout "serial nice guy" living a posh, carefree lifestyle off his deceased father's fortune; and the preteen Marcus (Nicholas Hoult), a bright but awkward youth who's tired of his mom Fiona's (Toni Collette) depressed, boyfriend-less state. Their paths collide when Will, deciding that single mothers are the easiest romantic conquests on the dating scene, fabricates a two-year-old son and joins a group called S.P.A.T. (Single Parents Alone Together). Marcus is wise to Will's scheme, however, and through some incessant pestering and blackmail, he contrives for Will to date Fiona. Though Will doesn't hit it off immediately with either Marcus or his mother, he gradually begins to open up to the people around him -- so much so that he attracts the attention of another attractive single mom (Rachel Weisz). A U.S./U.K. co-production of Robert DeNiro's Tribeca Films and Tim Bevan and Eric Fellner's Working Title (the company responsible for the Grant-related Four Weddings and a Funeral and Bridget Jones's Diary), About a Boy was co-written by What's Eating Gilbert Grape creator Peter Hedges(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Adam Sandler stars in a heartwarming update of the 1936 Frank Capra classic "Mr. Deeds Goes to Town." Sandler plays Gary Cooper's role, a kindhearted New Hampshire rube who inherits a fortune, then outsmarts some greedy city slickers in Manhattan. Winona Ryder, Peter Gallagher, John Turturro, Jared Harris(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Comedy about a born fighter who is thrown out of the army and winds up training a group of junior cadets. Major Payne (Damon Wayans) is ejected from the army after his commanding officer advises him that he has killed everyone and that there is no one left to fight. In desperation, the fearsome Payne finds a civilian job teaching combat skills to a mixed bunch of kids at a private school - and the results are hilarious!(n)

programme.title: Flipped
programme.desc: A young schoolboy realizes that the same girl he struggled to avoid may actually be his one true love in this coming-of-age romantic comedy from director Rob Reiner. Adapted from the book by Wendelin Van Draanen, Flipped tells the story of mischievous schoolboy Bryce (Callan McAuliffe) and his neighbor Juli (Madeline Carroll), who's had a crush on her girl-phobic classmate since second grade. Over the course of six years, Juli pines for Bryce as he does everything in his power to put her off. Later, as the pair enters junior high, Bryce discovers girls and the tide starts to shift. But will Juli still be interested after all that Bryce has done to keep her at arm's length? Rebecca De Mornay, Aidan Quinn, Anthony Edwards, and Penelope Ann Miller co-star(n)
