programme.title: Goodnight Moon & Other Sleepytime Tales
programme.desc: This HBO special features the classic children's tale Goodnight Moon by Margaret Wise Brown and Clement Hurd. The story is brought to life with vivid animation and narration by Susan Sarandon. Also included in this special nighttime collection for kids are Tony Bennett singing "Hit the Road to Dreamland," Lauryn Hill singing "Hush Little Baby," and comedian Billy Crystal reading the classic Mercer Mayer tale There's a Monster in My Closet(n)

programme.title: Pinky Dinky Doo
programme.desc: Tooting Trunk; In the Dark. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.sub-title: The Mother Goose Rappin' and Rhymin' Special
programme.desc: The Mother Goose Rappin' and Rhymin' Special. A unique animated rendition of classic nursery rhyme favorites with a rocking, upbeat musical score, Happily Ever After Fairy Tales for Every Child refreshes interest in the old rhymes for children as well as adults. In "Mother Goose," favorite titles like Humpty Dumpty and Little Miss Muppet are reenacted by famous voices like that of Whoopi Goldberg, Denzel Washington, and Jimmy Smits(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: The Three Little Pigs. A feminist twist on "The Three Little Pigs" finds the porcine characters obsessed with their weight---keeping it high, not low---at a camp for girls. Voices include Courteney Cox, Tyra Banks, Loretta Lynn, Sinbad(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: The delightfully hilarious gang from The Peanuts returns after 35 years for their silver screen debut. Join Charlie Brown, Lucy, Linus and friends on a new epic adventure while Snoopy tracks down his nemesis, the Red Baron. Charles M. Schulz's iconic characters are brought to life in state of the art 3D animation from Blue Sky Studios, the creators of the Ice Age films. Directed by Steve Martino. Screenwriters include Craig Schulz, one of Charles M. Schulz's sons and Bryan Schulz, Craig's son and Cornelius Uliano(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A kids' sci-fi comedy-adventure from director John Schultz and penned by British screenwriter Mark Burton. Teen maths whiz Tom Pearson is on holiday with his extended family at a remote lakeside cottage, where he and the other children make an unexpected discovery: four small, green extra-terrestrial creatures lurking in the loft. The aliens are freshly arrived from outer space and don't waste too much time in setting about their goal - the subjugation of mankind. However, it's equally swiftly apparent that their chosen method of conquest - a mind-control device - only works on adults. And so the scene is set for Tom and the other minors to make a brave stand against the incomers on behalf of Earth's human population(n)

programme.title: 101 Dalmatians
programme.desc: Live action remake of Disney's classic tale of a group of luckless puppies who are kidnapped by the evil Cruella De Vil who wants to turn them into a dalmatian fur coat. But with the help of some fellow four-legged friends, Pongo and Perdita (whose offspring are amongst the missing puppies) launch a rescue mission and nothing, not even Cruella's bumbling henchmen Jasper and Horace, will stop them! But with the help of some fellow four-legged friends, Pongo and Perdita (whose offspring are amongst the missing puppies) launch a rescue mission and nothing, not even Cruella's bumbling henchmen Jasper and Horace, will stop them! Joely Richardson and Jeff Daniels co-star as the hounds' hapless human owners(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: In this charming family film, Alvin, Simon and Theodore head out on the road in a desperate race to find Dave after they are led to believe that he is about to propose to his girlfriend and leave them behind forever(n)

programme.title: Disney's The Kid
programme.desc: Bruce Willis stars in this enchanting fantasy about a successful but unhappy image consultant named Russ, who changes his life after being magically visited by himself as an 8-year-old boy. The young Rusty doesn't like what he has become and gives his older self a second chance to get in touch with his childhood dreams. Spencer Breslin, Emily Mortimer, Lily Tomlin, Jean Smart(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: The delightfully hilarious gang from The Peanuts returns after 35 years for their silver screen debut. Join Charlie Brown, Lucy, Linus and friends on a new epic adventure while Snoopy tracks down his nemesis, the Red Baron. Charles M. Schulz's iconic characters are brought to life in state of the art 3D animation from Blue Sky Studios, the creators of the Ice Age films. Directed by Steve Martino. Screenwriters include Craig Schulz, one of Charles M. Schulz's sons and Bryan Schulz, Craig's son and Cornelius Uliano(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Now fully recovered from his amnesia, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne attempts to uncover the truth behind his father's death in this pulse-pounding sequel. At the same time, he must evade the government forces hot on his trail(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston go to the dogs with Marley & Me, a tale of a couple embarking on the adventure of marriage, career, family, and the world's worst dog. At least that's how writer and newlywed John comes to describe his blonde lab, Marley, when he takes the puppy home and finds that the fluff-ball has an uncanny ability to eat and/or destroy just about anything. As years go by, John and his wife, Jennifer, contemplate having babies and moving across the country, while Marley grows into 100 lbs. of funny, wild, completely untrainable canine companionship -- as well as one of the most important people in the family. Marley & Me is based on the best-selling autobiographical book by columnist John Grogan(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Comedy adventure set during the Vietnam War about a group of US soldiers who attempt to bring an elephant through the jungle for a friendly native village. A pair of army officers offer to find a new elephant for local villagers when their sacred beast becomes a casualty of war. Along with a trio of hapless assistants, they set off on a mission to deliver the animal to its new home(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: 08-23-2016. No. 1 overall pick QB Jared Goff continues in his development as a pro; the presence of Hall of Famer Mike Singletary is felt; and some players spend their day off in Disneyland(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A single and freewheeling travel writer finds that adapting to the nine-to-five lifestyle isn't as easy as it looks when her ailing father hires her to take control of his successful bridal magazine in this marriage-minded comedy starring Heather Graham, David Sutcliffe, Sandra Oh, and Taye Diggs. Upon returning to her hometown to once again be a bridesmaid in yet another wedding, jet-lagged, gin-soaked travel writer Pippa McGee (Graham) soon learns that her tyrannical publishing magnate father has been hospitalized after suffering a serious heart attack. As Pippa rushes to his bedside and the ailing mogul asks her to take editorial control of one of his most popular magazines, her excitement soon turns sour upon learning that the magazine in question is not a political or travel magazine, but the one and only Wedding Bells monthly. Determined to succeed despite the constant reminders of just how single she truly is, Pippa is horrified to learn that the man her father has chosen as her publishing mentor is the same man that she drunkenly came on to at her close friend's recent wedding(n)

programme.title: Closed Circuit
programme.desc: A major terrorism trial ensnares two ex-lovers who both play crucial roles on the defense team. When the lead defense attorney dies, his replacement proves to be the former lover of a Special Advocate with clearance to view classified evidence(n)

programme.title: Out for Justice
programme.desc: An action thriller about two boyhood rivals who grow into adult enemies on opposite sides of the law(n)

programme.title: Wes Craven Presents: They
programme.desc: After her best friend kills himself, a psychology student wonders whether the terror she experienced as a child was based in reality. Creepy horror with something nasty in the lift shaft(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: In this slick, slam-bang sequel mismatched cops head to Paris to unravel a plot by Triad gangs to assassinate a Chinese diplomat(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Fox Searchlight presents the tragic life story of rap star Notorious B.I.G. from director George Tillman Jr. (Soul Food) and executive producer Sean "Diddy" Combs. The script is provided by Cheo Hodari Coker and Biker Boyz writer/director Reggie Rock Blythewood. Jamal Woolard portrays the slain rapper, with Angela Bassett, Derek Luke, and Anthony Mackie filling out the supporting cast(n)

African-American Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's colour barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history(n)

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: Spike Lee's drama about a jazz musician who forms a professional rivalry with an outspoken saxophonist, while at the same time encountering problems in his love life(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Kal Penn and John Cho return in this outrageous and unrated sequel. The pot-smoking slacker pals are suspected of being terrorists---and have more irreverent misadventures with Neil Patrick Harris. Rob Corddry, Roger Bart, David Krumholtz, Eddie Kaye Thomas. Written and directed by Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg(n)

programme.title: Spring Breakdown
programme.desc: Gayle, Becky and Judi are three thirty-something friends who decide to break the monotony of their lives by vacationing on an island that's a popular spring break getaway for college coeds. One of them works for a powerful senator, and is also on a mission to prevent his daughter from embarrassing her family, only the girl is as geeky as her chaperones(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Portrait of a close-knit black family living in 1970s Brooklyn, as seen through the eyes of the youngest daughter. This comedy-drama follows them as they deal with money woes, eccentric neighbors and the sons' troublemaking(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: 08-30-2016. Scuffles break out at camp; 15 players are cut from the roster; the Rams head to Colorado for an encounter with the reigning Super Bowl champion Denver Broncos(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: The 1982 film version of the John Irving novel The World According to Garp attempts to captures the quirky spirit while condensing the Irving original. Robin Williams plays the title character, the son of unmarried, unorthodox feminist Jenny Fields (Glenn Close, in her film debut). Every effort made by Jenny to broaden Garp's outlook on life -- she even arranges for him to spend the night with a hooker (Swoosie Kurtz) -- crams more fears and phobias into his psyche. Aspiring to become a novelist, Garp succeeds in this goal at the same time that his mother publishes her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to college sweetheart Helen Holm (Mary Beth Hurt), Garp remains envious of his fearless mother, who has taken in the radical "Ellen Jamesians," a group named after a young woman who had her tongue cut out by a rapist. Mutilation, in fact, becomes something of a leitmotif in Garp's life, climaxing (in every sense of the word) in an auto accident brought about by Helen's tryst with Michael Milton (Mark Soper). There is, of course, much more to the story than this: standing out amongst the dozens of offbeat supporting characters is John Lithgow as Roberta Muldoon, a transexual ex-football jock. John Irving appears as a referee during a college wrestling match, while director George Roy Hill plays the pilot whose low-flying plane crashes into Garp's new home. The World According to Garp didn't attract as large an audience as other, more conventional Robin Williams vehicles, though Close and Lithgow would both be nominated for Best Supporting Actor statues(n)

programme.title: Powder
programme.desc: If you're a fan of The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles on Sky One then you'll want to see Sean Patrick Flanery's amazing performance in this acclaimed drama. He plays Powder, an albino boy whose mother died after giving birth to him and whose grandparents have recently died, leaving the 16-year-old boy alone in the basement where he has lived all his life. Emerging into an unaccepting and ignorant society, Powder soon finds his snow-white skin causing him big problems - but he is also blessed with a phenomenal IQ and some kind of ESP which win him friends in the reform school to which he is sent. Here he meets Jessie Caldwell (Mary Steenburgen), the school's head, and science teacher Donald Ripley (Jeff Goldblum), who between them decide to help Powder come to terms with life in the cruel real world(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Mild-mannered accountant Calvin (Kevin Hart) is stunned when he runs into an old high-school classmate named Bob (Dwayne Johnson) -- once an overweight and frequently bullied teen, Bob is now a CIA agent who's in perfect shape. However, their reignited friendship turns dangerous when Bob asks for Calvin's help with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites. Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber (We're the Millers)(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver learns the world of auto racing is fixed in this adrenaline-charged, live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: Soul Food
programme.desc: This hit domestic comedy-drama is based on George Tillman Jr's own family, is about the fortunes of an extended African-American family recalled through the eyes of young narrator Ahmad (Brandon Hammond). Ahmad's world revolves around his grandmother, Big Mama Joseph (Irma P. Hall) and her three daughters: workaholic lawyer Teri (Vanessa Williams), newlywed salon owner Bird (Nia Long), and Ahmad's housewife mom, Maxine (Vivica A. Fox). Each sister is in turmoil. Teri has lost patience for her husband Miles (Michael Beach), who wants to quit the law and take up music. Bird doesn't realise that her husband Lem (Mekhi Phifer) is about to be humiliated by her ex-boyfriend (Mel Jackson). And while Maxine's relationship with her husband Kenny (Jeffrey D. Sams) is going well, her relationship with her jealous sister Teri needs fixing. These conflicts boil over at Big Mama's traditional Sunday dinners, where the matriarch plays peacemaker. The ritual faces extinction, however, when Big Mama suffers a stroke - but Ahmad is waiting in the wings to take her place(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Hollywood held few fears for Chili Palmer in Get Shorty. Now the former loan shark is after bigger game: the music business. When he hears about the assassination of a music exec, Chili moves quickly to buy up the contract of star singer Linda(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: America's favourite family make their debut on the big screen in David Silverman's comedy. When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action: Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. The townsfolk, armed with torches and pitchforks, are soon after him, and the family have to flee to Alaska. But even Homer knows he must return to do the right thing... Warning: contains full frontal male nudity(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Crude Reality & Between Oil and Water
programme.desc: Crude Reality & Between Oil and Water. A report on South Sudan and how rampant corruption has brought the country to the brink of collapse just six years after winning independence; a chronicle of months of protesting by activists in North Dakota against the Dakota Access Pipeline(n)

programme.title: Rosewood
programme.desc: Powerful dramatisation of events leading to the obliteration of a black community by an angry mob in 1923 Florida(n)

programme.title: Off-Air
programme.desc: Off-Air(n)

programme.title: Mavis!
programme.desc: A look at the life of legendary soul singer Mavis Staples and her family group, the Staple Singers. Mavis was a trailblazer who developed a unique gospel sound and was actively involved in the civil rights movement(n)

programme.title: Adaptation
programme.desc: A screenwriter struggling to adapt a book decides to insert himself into the screenplay, with unexpected results(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: Speaking to a San Francisco journalist, vampire Louis tells the remarkable tale of his 200-year association with the vicious vampire Lestat. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A young boy discovers a peculiar island, where he finds a community of children with special abilities, after following a sequence of clues and must protect them(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Howard Payne is the taunting psycho threatening LA with high explosives, Jack Traven the agent who's close to catching him. When Payne loads a local bus with C4, Traven must evacuate the passengers while keeping the vehicle travelling at over 50mph. A breakneck recipe for thrills with a breakthrough role for Sandra Bullock(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: One of the wittiest, most charming film comedies ever made, Shakespeare in Love is a brilliantly fictional story behind the creation of one of the most enduring pieces of literature ever written by the most acclaimed writer of all-time. Plagued with debt, writer's block, and fallen far past deadline for his latest play, it seems like things can't get much worse for young William Shakespeare (Joseph Fiennes). Then Will meets Viola, a young lady masquerading as man(n)

programme.title: Mystic River
programme.desc: Childhood friends Jimmy, Sean and Dave are reunited by a tragedy involving one of their children. As homicide detective Sean investigates, Jimmy enlists his relatives to launch their own inquiry. Later, suspicions fall on Jimmy and Sean's old friend Dave(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Alex Jones. Alex Jones and InfoWars; Donald Trump's transgender military ban; Anthony Scaramucci; and the Senate's failure to pass the Health Care Freedom Act are discussed(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A young boy discovers a peculiar island, where he finds a community of children with special abilities, after following a sequence of clues and must protect them(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two unruly brothers (Zac Efron and Adam DeVine) are forced to find dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii by their parents, who hope that a couple of nice gals will keep their wild behavior under control. However, a pair of hard-partying ladies (Anna Kendrick and Aubrey Plaza) see a viral video in which they plead for dates, and decide to pretend to be the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip. Directed by Jake Szymanski(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realisation that they scared away their best friend's fiancée, hard-partying pals Evan and Jason set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Jill Sprecher's film follows five New Yorkers whose lives intertwine, from eternal optimist Alan Arkin to his pessimistic colleague John Turturro, with Matthew McConaughey as a hot-shot lawyer whose life is derailed by a road accident(n)

programme.title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
programme.desc: A demented doctor spends years on a desolate tropical island working on a drug that will effectively alter animals into humans. Based on the novel by H.G. Wells(n)

programme.title: My Fellow Americans
programme.desc: Jack Lemmon and James Garner team up for this hysterical comedy about a couple of ex-presidents who realise that they are being set up by the current occupant of the White House. Russell Kramer (Lemmon) and Matthew Douglas (Garner) could not be more different - they come from opposite ends of the political spectrum and move in different circles - in fact, the only thing they share is an utter loathing for one another! That all has to change when they both realise that they have been set up to take the blame for a major scandal which is about to rock the current President. Heading into the real America to search for the evidence which will clear their names, our heroes soon find themselves becoming unlikely best friends while encountering a variety of bizarre characters!(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: A radical group has seized control of a nuclear missile base and the USS Alabama, a state-of-the-art nuclear submarine, has been ordered into action in this taut thriller. But when a fragmented message arrives onboard to launch a defensive strike against the enemy, suddenly a fiery battle of wills erupts between the veteran sub commander - who never questions orders - and his more cautious second officer, who can't help but suspect a command to start a nuclear war. Gene Hackman and Denzel Washington star(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: A pop singer receives threatening notes and her manager hires a bodyguard. He ruffles the singer's feathers and most of her entourage by tightening security more than they feel is necessary. Eventually, the bodyguard and the singer start an affair and she begins to believe his precautions are necessary(n)

programme.title: Frost/Nixon
programme.desc: Frank Langella reprises his Tony Award-winning role in director Ron Howard's adaptation of Peter Morgan's acclaimed Broadway hit that recreates the explosive 1977 TV interview between disgraced former president Richard Nixon and David Frost(n)

programme.title: Nixon By Nixon: In His Own Words
programme.desc: Clips of declassified audiotapes of White House conversations featuring candid observations by former president Richard Nixon (1913-94) on the Vietnam War, the Pentagon Papers, the Supreme Court, people of color, women, Jews and the media(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Birth of a Nation'
programme.desc: A look at "The Birth of a Nation," a 2016 dramatic retelling of American-born Nat Turner's bloody rebellion to free slaves in Virginia in 1831. The film stars Nate Parker, Aja Naomi King and Armie Hammer, and is written and directed by Parker(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Bull Rush. Spencer goes to Las Vegas on business and gets reacquainted with an old flame who's working for Wayne. Meanwhile, Jason finds himself in a tough neighborhood after Joe sets him up to represent a top running back; Ricky challenges the odds in a game of dice; Charles gets a lesson in public speaking from Julie; and Vernon and Reggie mull a risky endorsement deal(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Hella Questions. A cryptic encounter tests Issa's interpretive skills; Lawrence mulls some important decisions; Molly plots to join the office "boys club" after being on the receiving end of a few harsh truths; Issa and Frieda deal with a difficult vice principal(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: A young misfit fulfils his ambition of joining a notorious gang of outlaws and meeting its enigmatic and celebrated leader, whom he has long idolised. As he spends more time with the group, however, he begins to resent his hero's capricious attitude and fear for his own life(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner (Nate Parker). Turner is ordered by his master (Armie Hammer) to tour a number of local plantations, delivering sermons to the other slaves that will urge them against violence and any thoughts of rebellion. However, he is so appalled and sickened by the horrors he sees during his travels that he is eventually moved to fight back against the evils of slavery. Aja Naomi King and Gabrielle Union co-star. Parker wrote, directed, and stars in The Birth of a Nation, which won the Grand Jury Prize at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Autism Under the Lens. Gianna Toboni reports on work being done at the forefront of autism research, meets families trying out the newest treatments and discovers a growing self-advocacy movement in the autism community that wants to refocus the science(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Alex Jones. Alex Jones and InfoWars; Donald Trump's transgender military ban; Anthony Scaramucci; and the Senate's failure to pass the Health Care Freedom Act are discussed(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos a young woman and brings her to his mansion atop a clay mountain. There, she learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets as she fights for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Deadpan. When one of her former students adapts her novel Mainly Murder as a stage play, Jessica (Angela Lansbury) is honored to attend the show's opening night. Not long afterward, the reviews come out, with one critic lavishing praise on the production, and the critic's chief rival penning a devastating pan. When then "positive" critic is murdered and the "negative" critic is accused of the crime, Jessica must come to the defense of a person who obviously despises her!(n)

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: A Christmas Hart. The Harts are robbed while employees of a singing-telegram company perform at Max's birthday party. Lionel Stander, Stefanie Powers, Robert Wagner. Billingsley: John Reilly. Sutton: Steven Hirsch(n)

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: Hunted Harts. A business adversary lures the Harts to South America for some hunting---with Jonathan as prey. Stefanie Powers, Robert Wagner. Davenport: Ian Bannen. Liza: Tippi Hedren. Geoffrey: David McCallum(n)

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Obsession. Confined to his bed in a hospital, Matlock still can't banish from his mind the case of a TV celebrity who has been accused of murdering a therapist(n)

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Divorce. Matlock and Leanne find themselves on opposite sides of a divorce case while Leanne defends Matlock in a lawsuit. Carl Fuqua: Thomas Ryan. Clara Farmington: Nana Visitor. Duncan Farmington: James Stephens. Matlock: Andy Griffith. Leanne: Brynn Thayer(n)

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Competition. Matlock does not believe that a talented young pianist committed suicide, a view that is shared by her father – but what really happened?(n)

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Play. The play's the thing when an actress in a theater production is murdered---and the director (Rene Auberjonois) is cast as the killer. Glenda: Deborah Winstead. Jane Dryden: Leslie Wing. Beth Samuels: Amy Parrish. Flora Michaels: Candy Aston. Matlock: Andy Griffith. Billy: Warren Frost(n)

programme.title: Columbo
programme.sub-title: Caution: Murder Can Be Hazardous to Your Health
programme.desc: Caution: Murder Can Be Hazardous to Your Health. The dishevelled detective is called in to investigate when a chain-smoking TV producer is found dead at his home, apparently the victim of a massive heart attack. Columbo suspects that the producer's former partner, the host of a crime-busting TV series, is involved. But she has a seemingly watertight alibi, which has been captured on video(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Sins of the Father. Crime drama series about a sleuthing doctor. Could the investigation into the murder of a young woman hold the key to the actions of Mark Sloan's father decades ago?(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: You Bet Your Life. A successful cardiologist, who is also a compulsive gambler, commits murder when he can't pay off his gambling debts---but then he is slain himself(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Bachelor Fathers. Jesse's ex-girlfriend, Grace, shows up and tells him he's the father of her baby. She wants Jesse to keep the child while she helps her sister try to pay back money stolen from a drug dealer(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Being of Sound Mind. Dr Sloan tries to protect Jesse and Amanda from a murderer determined to get his hands on a multi-million-dollar inheritance(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Takes a Punch. US drama series about a former detective turned private eye who has a photographic memory and an uncanny ability to piece together clues and solve cases. programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Psychic. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Billionaire Mugger
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Billionaire Mugger. Apparently suffering from a mid-life crisis that causes moments of bizarre whimsy, billionaire computer executive Sidney Teal (J.C. McKenzie) pulls a gun and attempts to rob a couple outside a restaurant--and is killed in the process. Though beset with financial problems, and facing the possible loss of his trusted nurse Sharona (Bitty Schram), Monk (Tony Shalhoub)agrees to investigate Teal's death, and the reasons behind it. Perhaps the answer can be gleaned from the two people whom the dead man mugged...or perhaps the solution is in the hands of Officer Moretta (Jonathan Rannells) the cop at the crime scene who inexplicably ran away before back-up arrived--and hasn't been seen since. (Note: the scene in which Monk discusses clues pertaining to the earlier death of his wife with writer Kelly Street [Mary Black] was actually filmed for, but removed from, Monk's two-hour pilot episode)(n)

Under normal circumstances, the principal suspect would be Gwen's lover, brash young furniture mogul Trevor McDowell (Peter Outerbridge). But McDowell has the perfect alibi: He was running in the marathon, and he has irrefutable evidence to prove it. Still convinced that McDowell is guilty, Monk hopes that he can prove his theory with the roundabout assistance of his lifelong idol, legendary Nigerian marathoner Tonday Mawaaka (Zakes Mokae)--not to mention his own long-suppressed running skills!(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: A doctor dabbles in magical resurrection with horrific consequences in this supernatural thriller adapted from the novel by Stephen King. When Dr. Louis Creed (Dale Midkiff) and his family move from Chicago to an old farmhouse in rural Maine, their only concern is the busy highway that flanks their new home. Louis' family -- wife Rachel (Denise Crosby), daughter Ellie (Blaze Berdahl), and toddler Gage (Miko Hughes) -- soon meet kindly old duffer Jud Crandall (Fred Gwynne), who introduces them all to the local attractions, including a pet cemetary built on the remains of a Native American burial ground. When Rachel and the kids head off to visit Louis' in-laws, Ellie's cat gets flattened by a truck. Jud counsels Louis to bury it in the old Indian portion of the cemetary; the next day, it returns from the dead, carrying with it the stink of the earth and a decidedly bad attitude. Shortly thereafter, Louis is tempted to use the cemetary's magical powers again when his son suffers a tragic accident. A snarling kitty, it turns out, is nothing compared to the horror of a little boy with no soul and a taste for scalpels. In addition to adapting his own novel for the screen, writer King appeared in a brief cameo as the minister presiding over Gage's funeral. Director Mary Lambert would return with Pet Sematary Two(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary II

After a friend's dog is killed, Geoff and the boy discover and make use of a 'sematary' with the power to reanimate the dead..(n)

As his 23-day feeding frenzy draws to a close, The Creeper needs the sort of nourishment only a vital group of young athletes can provide, and to survive the night, the terrified teens will have to fight to their dying breaths(n)

With only days until the wedding of Rosie and Dylan - who isn't endearing himself to anybody - tempers are already running high when Du Plessis finds out his heart is weak. programme.desc: When police sergeant Pete Garvey is killed, the investigation proves harrowing for Devlin as he was one of his best friends. The detective discovers the officer had recently been in contact with their childhood parish priest Jonathan Nugent, who Pete claimed sexually abused him as a child. Unable to place a straightforward murder charge against Nugent, Steel and Phillips take an unusual approach to bring him to trial. Guest starring Matthew Marsh, Ruth Gemmell and Patrick Malahide, with Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part two of two. The serial killing of men comes to a halt, but the abduction of a widow indicates the perpetrator has broadened his ambitions - and murder is not his only motivation. Psychopath Michael makes good his escape from the secure unit, wearing the clothes of the prison chaplain he duped, and Tony is lined up as his next victim. Drama, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib.(n)

programme.title: Life of Crime
programme.desc: In 2013, things are looking up for Denise as she is interviewed for the position of superintendent, but life away from work isn't going so well, with ex-husband Ray dropping the bombshell that her estranged daughter is pregnant. Meanwhile, the case of a recent murder victim flags up the same `unknown' DNA from 1985 and 1997. Throwing caution to the wind, the police officer once again focuses on finding Amy Reid's killer, giving her the chance to put her demons to rest. Drama, starring Hayley Atwell, Richard Coyle and Amanda Drew. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect
programme.sub-title: Prime Suspect VI: The Last Witness.
programme.desc: Helen Mirren stars as no-nonsense detective Jane Tennison. A Bosnian illegal immigrant's body is found covered in horrific torture wounds, and Tennison goes against her boss's retirement suggestion to take charge of the murder squad and catch the culprit, causing tensions to rise within her team. Chief Inspector Finch suspects the death is connected to an underworld gang, but Tennison thinks otherwise - believing the case to be linked to the devastating war in the victim's home country. With Ben Miles, Barnaby Kay, Robert Pugh, Mark Strong and Tony Pritchard.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Old family friends Frank and Jennie Woolworth arrive in London and Harry is immediately suspicious he might have some competition on his hands. Determined to seize the advantage, he plans a mid-season sale - but there's little chance he can match his rivals' low prices. Meanwhile, life turns awkward for Rose when she runs into Roddy at Lady Mae's soiree, Agnes and Henri's working relationship steps up a gear, and Mr Grove's behaviour continues to confuse Miss Mardle.(n)

programme.title: Davina McCall: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: Davina travels to the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard in the Arctic Circle, a harsh environment set across 15 million sq km of sea ice where temperatures can drop to -40C. She learns how huskies' thick fur is better insulation than goose down, that the deep pads on their paws protect them from the cold and their almond shaped eyes mean they are less exposed in a blizzard. She also tracks a polar bear to the open sea and witnesses bearded seals using their whiskers like feelers to find shrimp and crab on the ocean floor.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack are chosen to go on a training course. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack are assigned by Blakey to take a class of rowdy schoolchildren on their annual outing. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant.(n)

programme.desc: Jack and Stan volunteer Olive as supervisor for the depot nursery. However, when she breaks her glasses and has to go home for a spare pair the clueless duo are left holding the fort. Comedy, starring Reg Varney, Bob Grant and Anna Karen.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is on hand to help a puppet designer when he runs into difficulties with his own creations - but after a security guard is killed, she finds herself on the trail of a murderer. Detective drama, guest starring Malcolm in the Middle's Bryan Cranston, with Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Aspen, Colorado, where her friend Laney Boswell comes under suspicion for the murder of her estranged husband. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury and Leigh Taylor-Young.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes disguises himself as a plumber to gain access to the home of a blackmailing art dealer who targets members of high society. Robert Hardy guest stars in a feature-length episode of the period drama, with Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: When a wealthy businessman is killed in a mysterious explosion aboard his fishing boat and suspicion falls on his son, Wycliffe feels sure the real culprit is to be found elsewhere and unearths several locals with a motive for murder. Jack Shepherd stars as the Cornish copper, with Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill.(n)

programme.title: Rest in Peace, Mrs Columbo
programme.desc: The wife of a criminal who died in prison swears revenge on the men she holds responsible for his incarceration - including Columbo. She kills one of her targets, and the shabby sleuth is assigned to the case. As she faces his well-honed approach to sniffing out a suspect, she plots to murder his wife. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Helen Shaver and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Steven Mullan is found beaten and drowned in his bath. Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star, with guest appearances by Jenny Seagrove and Julian Wadham.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An American female bishop visiting St Gerard's College is found dead after drinking poisoned wine, and when another two killings occur, both mirroring macabre murders from Jacobean revenge tragedy, it appears the culprit is targeting candidates in the election to become vice-regent. However, when Innocent learns one of the suspects is hiding a dark secret, Lewis and Hathaway realise the motive is much more twisted. Guest starring Sian Phillips and Ronald Pickup, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When an RAF officer is found hanged in a wood, Meredith - the new chief superintendent at Hastings - is quick to dismiss it as a straightforward suicide. However, an aerial photo of a German village found in the dead man's pocket leads Milner to suspect murder. The newly retired Foyle is compelled to return to service when events take an even more unexpected turn. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks agrees to help old friend and partner Jimmy Valentine with an undercover drug sting, but when the bust goes wrong and a dealer ends up dead, suspicion falls on the officers. As Devlin pushes for the truth, the spotlight turns on Brooks' dark past, and a 10-year-old case involving no witnesses and a large quantity of missing heroin. Guest starring Hustle's Robert Glenister, former Rising Damp star Don Warrington and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral), alongside Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman.(n)

Furious at the police's inability to bring the killers to justice, he takes the law into his own hands to get revenge. Crime thriller, starring Michael Caine, Emily Mortimer, Charlie Creed-Miles, Ben Drew, Iain Glen and Sean Harris.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Pensioner Margaret Jones accuses her dry-cleaner Sam of stealing her winning lottery ticket after he begins driving around in a new car. The investigation leads the detectives to a travel agent where her husband recently bought a cruise, but the case seems solved when they discover it was Sam who cashed in the winnings.(n)

programme.title: The Blackheath Poisonings
programme.desc: Part three of three. Paul concludes his investigation into the mysterious murder of his father Roger. Christine Kavanagh, Zoe Wanamaker and Julia St John star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Georgina undergoes training at Guy's Hospital in the hope of becoming a nurse, while James does his best to return to the front line and Daisy reveals her plans to work on the London buses.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack and Christine's relationship begins to cause problems for the team, who are still reeling from the death of Yvonne, while Sam makes a shocking confession and Robert goes on the warpath. Mike's chances of getting the registrar job are jeopardised by his recent mistake, and Cathy's departure leaves him feeling even worse. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian sailor claims political asylum when his ship docks in Whitby, while Greengrass finds an unlikely partner in crime.(n)

programme.desc: Walker discovers Zelda's secret and attempts to blackmail her, forcing her into hiding, while Angelique fears Bernhardt has been killed when the British shoot down a number of German planes. James takes Eugene's parents to the site of their son's execution, but Von Rheingarten throws them off the property before befriending Philip, whom he still believes to be a local gardener.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The old poem about the boy standing on the burning deck takes on new meaning as Kavanagh defends two Navy officers accused of arson, and finds he cannot use his only defence. It is a tough case, and the last thing he needs is extra stress at home - but that does not stop the children planning an anniversary party without telling him. With Andy Serkis, Ray Winstone and Geraldine James.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: There is trouble in the village when local children get their hands on some wartime ammunition, while Greengrass locks horns with Lord Ashfordly's new gamekeeper and Kate realises she is pregnant.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Prudence and Hazel disagree about a tea-party for wounded officers due to be held at Eaton Place. Rose has an unexpected reunion with a farmer from Australia who she almost married before the war.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A no-nonsense risk manager arrives to investigate the Ronny Davidson case, putting the whole department under strain in the absence of holiday-makers Christine and Jack. Mike clashes with Robert over a patient he dismissed as just another drug addict when it turns out the youngster is suffering from sickle cell anaemia. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: David Suchet takes on his final case as the Belgian sleuth in the last-ever episode of the long-running drama. Crippled with arthritis, Poirot is now using a wheelchair and has a life-threatening heart condition, but remains as sharp as ever. Calling on old friend Captain Hastings for assistance, he returns to Styles, where the pair first met 30 years earlier on a murder investigation. The detective is convinced the country house is once again harbouring a killer, and as guests fall victim to a mysterious attacker, he must summon the last of his strength to battle his ultimate nemesis. With Hugh Fraser, Anne Reid, Philip Glenister, Helen Baxendale, Matthew McNulty, Anna Madeley and Shaun Dingwall.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for Xun Li, a missing devoted husband and father who has a successful property business, soon escalates into a kidnap and ransom case. However, with the perpetrators cleverly staying one step ahead of the police, it becomes clear that they are not dealing with average criminals. When it appears that the case is closed, Banks and the team are are faced with an unexpected turn of events. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz and Jack Deam.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part Two.
programme.desc: The team is thrown when a recently rescued kidnap victim is found murdered, with evidence suggesting a local protection gang is to blame. However, apprehending the woman they suspect proves challenging, as witnesses know the price they will pay for talking to the police. Meanwhile, Banks discovers a long-buried secret. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch

Ellie and Hardy can feel the vice tightening on the culprit and know that the case will crack open soon. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry.(n)

programme.desc: Unable to get used to the fact she was second choice for the sergeant's job, Rachel punishes Janet for keeping the truth from her, and although Will cheers her up with the news she has been chosen for a vice initiative, the detective is soon stung by Gill's harsh words. Meanwhile, an unconscious baby is admitted to hospital with injuries that do not match his parents' explanation of events, and when an unregistered childminder and her boyfriend enter the equation, it's unclear who had the boy's best interests at heart.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel can't get Gill's remarks about her fling with Will out of her head, so ducks out of attending an awards ceremony with him, fearing their colleagues will believe she's sleeping her way to the top. He finally decides that dating her is too much like hard work and so announces they are no longer an item - a move that leaves Rachel gutted and regretting her behaviour. Janet isn't happy either - it's clear her daughter Elise is about to have her heart broken by Eleanor's son Ade. The duo are soon distracted from their woes by a new case involving the murder of a landlord and his wife who were shot at close range in their pub.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with old friend Ariadne Oliver, who has been commissioned to stage a game of murder hunt at a summer fete in the grounds of Nasse House, the recently purchased home of wealthy financier Sir George Stubbs. However, the novelist's instincts tell her she's getting involved in something much darker - and she's proved right when the girl volunteering to play the part of the victim really does turn out to be dead. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Zoe Wanamaker, Sean Pertwee, Martin Jarvis, Sam Kelly, Sinead Cusack, Rosalind Ayres and Tom Ellis.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with sidekick Captain Hastings (Hugh Fraser), secretary Miss Lemon (Pauline Moran) and Inspector Japp (Philip Jackson) in a case that plunges him into the world of global espionage as the Second World War looms. The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad, as a complex plot by a gang of dangerous dissidents sees a host of international figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames.(n)

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: Liam Neeson stars as former CIA operative Bryan Mills, who's desperate to track down his kidnapped daughter in Pierre Morel's Luc Besson-produced action-thriller. Mills' life hasn't panned out well; his dedication to the CIA wrecked his marriage and made him neglect his daughter Kim. Now, retired from the Agency, he wants to make things up to Kim. But to do so, he has to contend with his ex-wife's animosity and Kim's new step-father's wealth. So when he has an opportunity to advance Kim's pop star ambitions he jumps at the chance, even if that means her and a friend crossing the Atlantic to brave 'the dangers of Europe'. As things turn out, he has a point: in Paris, the two girls are kidnapped by vicious Eastern European sex traffickers. As they are being abducted, Bryan tells one of the baddies, via Kim's mobile phone: 'I will look for you, I will find you, and I will kill you'. He subsequently does his best to make good on his promise, using all the violent tricks of the trade his time at the CIA taught him(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Clive and Carol Stephens, who want to relocate from their family home in Romford, Essex, to St Lucia in the Caribbean, so she searches the island for their dream property on a budget of £250,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Charing, Kent, where landlady Natalie Palmer hopes to show that her B&B, The Oak, is better than any of her guests' establishments. Everything starts off well when a couple are delighted to have enough room for their yoga mats, but the rest of the party are unimpressed with the extractor fans.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the White Lady in Worstead, Norfolk, on their second night, where proprietor Dennis Gilligan tells his guests about a spooky presence that resides there. The guests get competitive in a round of clay shooting, and debate whether they believe in the existence of ghosts.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Cranleigh House B&B in Combe Martin, Devon, where former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those who enjoy yoga and are seeking spiritual enlightenment. They hope the group will send out energy for world peace and healing, but Mike and Denise question whether the whole thing is a joke.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Denise Mitchell welcome the contestants to Beaches B&B in Paignton, Devon, which only opened for business a few weeks ago. Fellow competitor Katherine puts the owners through their paces at breakfast when she asks for something off the menu, and the hosts are pleasantly surprised at feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together for one last time to discover what they have been paid, and the identity of the winner. The Oak owner Natalie wants to know why some of her guests were not enthused by her extractor fans, but she herself receives aggression from Dennis over her criticism of the White Lady. Katherine and Stuart defend their vegetarian breakfast, and Mike and Denise deal with negative comments about their cereal selection.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Hampshire sailing enthusiasts Berto and Angie Janssen look for a holiday home for their family in south Tenerife, and discovers the uncertain global economic climate means their budget of £250,000 can go a long way.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists excavate a site in Leicestershire, which they believe contains an Anglo-Saxon burial ground. Though their initial search for a cemetery proves fruitless, more digging leads to the experts uncovering evidence of several types of funeral, as well as a highly valuable piece of jewellery - and one member of the team volunteers to take part in a re-creation of a cremation ceremony from the period.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on their 200th dig, examining the bed of a reservoir in a valley high up on Dartmoor in Devon. The specially drained site presents difficulties with its abundance of thick mud, but the archaeological experts uncover a network of monuments that suggests the existence of a major prehistoric site. Their efforts are further rewarded with the discovery of the first stone henge in Britain for a century.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Worried dog-sitters Natasha and Josiah arrive at the clinic with eight-year-old Bam Bam, a Maltese terrier who has lost half of his body weight. Blood tests confirm Scott's suspicion that Bam Bam is diabetic. The terrier is in a critical condition and needs immediate treatment if he is to survive. Bam Bam is placed on a drip for several days to try to bring him back from the brink. Scott's sister-in-law Dawn calls to say her children have found a ring-necked parakeet refusing to eat or drink and in shock. Scott takes the bird to the clinic for an examination and realises that it will need a special home, so decides to try to sweet-talk Dawn into taking on another family member.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets Ruth Tidd, who is attempting to make an ice-cream parlour out of a caravan once used to house chickens. He also tries out the country's first-ever tree tent and visits some unusual offices built from four old train carriages, and travels to Barcelona for a closer look at a tiny studio flat that thinks it's a five-room apartment. Back at his own caravan, George designs a sofa that doubles up as a bath.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised.(n)

programme.title: Dicte - Crime Reporter
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dicte, Torsten and Rose attend a football match to cheer on Rose's boyfriend Jannik, who is the star of the local team. However, the match ends with a huge fight in the stands - and Jannik makes a shocking discovery. Wagner has suspicions about the leader of a local gang of hooligans and Dicte decides to infiltrate the group. The case soon takes a very different turn as Dicte finds herself investigating the possibility of match-fixing. Wagner gathers evidence against the brother of the hooligan gang leader, but Dicte suspects that Rose's boyfriend Jannik and the rest of the players in the football team are not as innocent as everyone assumes. Crime drama, starring Iben Hjejle and Lars Brygmann. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-year-old mechanical engineer Graham is rushed into King's College Hospital in south London with a suspected heart attack, and after his brother reminisces about their carefree youth, the doctor suggests Graham's problems may be related to his more recent stressful lifestyle. Meanwhile, 71-year-old Pat is found unconscious by her husband, and 65-year-old Mick is discovered lying in the street with blood coming out of his ear. In both cases, the medics suspect brain haemorrhages, so scans are required.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Among those arriving at King's College Hospital is 56-year-old Malcolm, who is put on life support after a cardiac arrest. Nightclub host Phil, 36, receives treatment for chronic pain in his back and side, and realises his party lifestyle is taking its toll, while medics discover 61-year-old Bob has suffered a stroke. Doctors also see to Kamilla, 12, who has been knocked down by a car on a pedestrian crossing.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for West Babylon, New York, to help the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts. The chef struggles to cope with disorganised staff and an unappealing menu, but quickly realises the real problem lies in the kitchen, where a lack of leadership and communication is causing serious trouble.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Extended edition. Patsy Palmer, Jack Whitehall, Krishnan Guru-Murthy and Joe Wilkinson join team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock on the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. The contestants answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie and the team meet single mother Sam and try to turn her rather drab dwelling into a dream home.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton goes house-hunting in Denia, on Spain's Costa Blanca, for a couple from Exeter who have a budget of £120,000 and want a property they can use for holidays and their eventual retirement.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton comes to the aid of a couple from Yorkshire who are searching for a large property for holidays with members of their extended family in the north of Tenerife, working with a budget of £360,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Shelley and David Warner in their search for a property in Daytona, Florida, and shows them what they can get for their £230,000 budget. The Essex couple have high hopes as house prices in the sunshine state have fallen in recent times.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps retired couple Paul and Lindy, from the Midlands, search for a suitable property on the Costa del Azahar in Spain.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In Grasmere, chef Kevin Tickle goes foraging to cook some local dishes at his Forest Side restaurant, and in Wensleydale, gamekeeper David Hutchinson readies the estate for a shoot.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Taxi driver Nik Christides hosts the first party in east Hampshire, where one guest causes a stir by revealing details of a romantic encounter with Boyzone singer Ronan Keating. Later, Nik introduces his diners to the sport of Cheesy Darts, which requires one guest to smear their face with cream, before having cheese-flavoured crisps thrown at them.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-four Jax Naudi hosts the second dinner party in east Hampshire, but her theme for the evening causes confusion and leads to one guest wearing an inappropriate outfit. Although Sue Hood expresses her distaste for the host's menu by remaining silent throughout the meal, the mood improves when Jax reveals the evening's entertainment - life drawing with a nude model.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Natalie Edemska-Plant hosts the third dinner party in east Hampshire, and plans to serve dishes from her childhood to give her guests an authentic Russian dining experience. She begins the evening with traditional customs such as banning shoes inside the house, and although her food is not a complete success, the night ends on a high note with some energetic dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: History fanatic Kyle Curtis hosts the fourth dinner party from east Hampshire. A self-confessed novice in the kitchen, he decides to get his guests to help him with his main course - a fish fondue - and his choice of dress code for the evening proves a hit.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sue Hood hosts the final night of the culinary competition in east Hampshire, hoping to impress her guests with a Caribbean-themed dinner party. The evening kicks off with the diners taking turns hitting a pinata, followed by entertainment in the form of dancers before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the 12th-century Oxenham Arms, Devon, where owners Simon and Lyn Powell hope to kick-off the competition in style. The guests participate in broom dancing and after throwing some moves, the hosts have fellow contestant John pegged as the one to watch.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Elegant House bed and breakfast in Liverpool on their second night, where host John Brady hopes his unique property will stand out from the crowd. Nikki and David get to grips with the unconventional facilities, and David reveals his background as a hotel inspector - with Amanda making her opinions on the star rating system very clear.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Monmouthshire, where Peter and Amanda Copp want to rope their guests into the world of `glamping' at Hidden Valley Yurts. John has a hairy encounter in his yurt, and the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress David and Nikki. The next morning, the DIY breakfast proves underwhelming for some, while the hosts discover that the great outdoors is not everyone's cup of tea.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former hotel inspector and owner David Stanbridge and manager Nikki Deans welcome the contestants to the Cley Hall Hotel in Spalding, Lincolnshire. Peter and Amanda are impressed by their room, but Simon and Lyn are unhappy with the state of the carpet. The next morning, the guests decide to put their eight-minute breakfast rule to the test, and some of them have concerns about Nikki's waitressing skills.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet for the final time to find out what they've been paid and confront their critics. Simon and Lyn kick off proceedings by demanding answers from John about his disturbed night's sleep, but then find themselves taken to task by David over their cleanliness feedback. However, the former hotel inspector receives his own interrogation from Peter and Amanda, who want to know why he didn't praise their shared bathroom facilities. Tensions run high as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Penelope Keith at Her Majesty's Service
programme.desc: The actress travels around the country to visit the Queen's official residences and meet people with royal appointments. The journey begins in Windsor Castle, where she finds out about Britain's oldest order of chivalry, meets the Royal Herb Strewer and unearths a box of treasure dating back to Elizabeth I. She also takes a trip up the Thames in the gilded barge Gloriana.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: This episode reveals how Prince Philip was the Windsors' most radical moderniser, and explores how he compensated for his emasculated status in one of the most daring experiments in modernisation attempted by the Windsors. The focus also falls on the formidable opposition that the young Queen Elizabeth II faced during her early years in the throne, as influential figures opposed her bearing her husband's family name, Mountbatten.(n)

programme.title: The Queen's Coronation: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the conflict between the Queen Mother and Prince Philip over how to administer Princess Elizabeth's coronation in 1953. While the public was presented with an image of the Windsors as a firmly united family, the pair clashed over Philip's desire to introduce the population to a monarchy ready to adapt to modern times. This programme charts the Queen Mother's efforts to protect the royal reputation she helped rebuild after the abdication of Edward VIII.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: The stars of 8 Out of 10 Cats take on the long-running quiz for a second time, as Sean Lock faces Jon Richardson in a rematch of their original encounter on the pilot show. Jimmy Carr hosts proceedings, while maths whizz Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers, with a little help from comedian Joe Wilkinson. David O'Doherty and Susie Dent are in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Producers
programme.desc: A washed-up Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant hatch a fraudulent get-rich-quick scheme involving the staging of the worst production of all time and making sure it closes on opening night. They soon find the perfect play for the job - a musical tribute to Adolf Hitler. Musical remake of Mel Brooks' comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Nathan Lane, Uma Thurman and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.desc: As the investigation into the cold-case murder continues, the forensic team discovers that the marks on the victim's body are consistent with known gangland torture methods. With this in mind, Cassie and Sunny question Sir Phillip about his involvement with a prominent East End crime family 40 years ago. Did the businessman or any of the shady associates of his youth have anything to do with Jimmy's disappearance or murder? Meanwhile, Eric and Claire's anniversary gets under way. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Trevor Eve and Tom Courtenay.(n)

programme.title: The Coroner

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigates the shooting of a murder suspect, and there is no shortage of potential culprits, with his angry wife and vengeful brother high on the list. There's just one little puzzle to solve before the cops can even think about whodunit - at the time of the killing, the victim was in police custody, behind three locked doors guarded by Dwayne and JP. So how did the shooter manage to slip through undetected? As if that wasn't enough for Humphrey to worry about, he also has an unexpected visit from his father (guest star James Fox), with whom he doesn't exactly see eye to eye. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Ireland
programme.desc: Fergal Keane explores Ireland's cultural, economic and social history, documenting its role on the international stage. He begins by revisiting the origins of the Celtic people, detailing the impact of Christianity and monasticism, the emergence of early literature, and the formation of law tracts that provide an insight into the day-to-day life of people nearly 1,500 years ago.(n)

programme.desc: The tourists take a cruise around Halong Bay, where they catch a glimpse of the endangered Langur monkeys. The party then flies south to to Ho Chi Minh City. They visit the sobering War Remnants Museum before exploring the city at night on vespas, where they go in search of local street food and try to keep up with the city's seven and a half million motorbikes.(n)

programme.title: Living the Wildlife
programme.desc: Camerman Colin Stafford-Johnson goes in search of the great crested grebe, a bird with extravagant plumage. As the birds nest alongside rivers with thick reeds, they can be tricky to spot, so he dons a pair of waders and keeps an eye out for the elusive animal. Next, he looks for otters in Co Kerry, which proves difficult after a swollen river has washed away their tracks.(n)

programme.desc: Aeronautical engineer Brendan Walker looks at how the reliance on increasingly complex technology in planes could cause pilots to make new kinds of errors. Scotland Yard is baffled by a mysterious criminal who is defacing images of Margaret Thatcher, and Sherlock is convinced there is a more sinister purpose at work behind these acts of vandalism - but his investigation digs up Mary Watson's dark past as an assassin. Benedict Cumberbatch, Martin Freeman and Amanda Abbington return for a fourth series of the detective drama.(n)

programme.title: Relic Hunter
programme.desc: Sydney delves into her grandmother's past with the help of a trunkful of belongings to unravel the mystery surrounding a stolen locket. Adventure series, starring Tia Carrere.(n)

programme.title: Relic Hunter

programme.title: The Flash

programme.desc: Life in the Devon fishing port of Brixham. programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor heads to New Orleans and meets soul singer Irma Thomas at the Hotel de Monteleone, an establishment that was popular with writers such as Tennessee Williams, F Scott Fitzgerald and Ernest Hemingway. Richard speaks to Steel Magnolias author Robert Harling about the Soniat House, check into the supposedly haunted Hotel Maison de Ville and talks to burlesque dancer Chrissy Owens at the Roosevelt.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor heads to Tokyo and checks out the Park Hyatt, the hotel featured in the film Lost in Translation, and goes behind the closed doors of the Japanese capital's love hotels. In the fashionable district of Meguro, Richard takes in the Claska, which was the city's first boutique hotel and has its own canine beauty salon.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Rumours concerning Fidel Castro's deteriorating health cause the president to reconsider the economic sanctions that America has imposed on Cuba. programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Bruno Gianelli advises Senator Vinick about how to ensure he is successful in the forthcoming election and get his religious views across to voters. President Bartlet devises a scheme to tackle the issue of the minimum wage. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Ron Silver.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A teenager approaches the team and asks for their help, claiming she was kidnapped as a child. Meanwhile, Jack considers returning to Chicago. Crime drama, starring Anthony LaPaglia.(n)

In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
